text: Anything in their menu is delicious, I have tried all famous Greek restaurants, this one by far is the best.

Freshly baked pita bread.
Piles of gyros meat.
Delicious hummus, salad, and rice with most orders.
Around $10!

I was impressed with the service, deliciousness of the food, and how much of it I got for the price I paid. Would recommend and will visit again if I am in the Phoenix again.

First time here and loved it! Highly recommend the steak shwarma sandwich with the homemade pita. Atmosphere is very warm, clean restaurant with staff that is friendly and attentive. will be visiting again

The food here is the bombdigiddy!

Me and my friends were looking for a place to eat and randomly decided on this one. I personally wasn't expecting much. Boy was I wrong. The prices based on the humongous portion you get are amazing (less than $10). 

I got the Gyro Platter. It came with a Gyros on a bed of rice (one can also get potatoes instead of rice), a side salad, hummus, tzatziki, and a pita. The gyros were flavorful and a little on the salty side but I found them perfect because they balanced out when eaten with the blandish rice. Salad was pretty standard. Their hummus was really good and you could tell it was homemade as opposed to the stuff you get from the store. The best part however, was their tzatziki. Omg BEST tzatziki I've ever had. Tangy and super flavorful with a strong dill flavor which is just the way I like it.

This place is very similar to a cafeteria. One will go up and order and then grab a number and take a seat and wait for them to bring it to you (if you ordered it for inside) or for them to call your number (if you ordered takeout). A lot of stuff is self serve so you don't have to pay tip which is great in my books. I will definitely be back!
Love this place! Consistent experience every time we go there to eat! Its clean and the staff are awesome too.
I had the 10'' gyros.  It was delicious, I highly recommend this place.  If you are a Midwestern student you get a  10% discount

Tried this place out with my boyfriend and daughter,I ordered the gyros place and my boyfriend ordered the shawarma plate. We arrived an hour before they closed and it took 30mins for our order to come out. Mind you that they close pretty early at 8. So we only had another 30 to eat before they closed. So It was kind of a bummer that our order took so long. When we finally got our food it's pretty much a bang for your buck they give you a pretty good amount of meat and the side of your choice plus two salads and 2 warm pita breads. It was tasty and my tummy was def happy. Defiantly daughter approved for my little one. I also ordered spanakopita.(layered philo dough with a filling of spinach and ricotta cheese or feta maybe..) it was only $1 I was expecting it to be a decent size but nothing too big. What I got was literally a bite size triangle piece of spanakopita. I wish they had made them bigger because I've always wanted to try them thanks to food network and they were so tasty,just not a fan of how bite sized they are. I like the place and where it's located. I docked down a star because it took a long time for our food and the little bite size pie. Other than that I would definitely go back.
Love this place! Can get busy especially at lunch but that is because it is soo good!
It is ok. But it take's for ever to get my chicken kabob, like 20 min. And it stinks when you get in the restaurant. It was better last year.
Excellent gyro. Place was packed at lunch. I had a regular gyro and a side of tzatziki sauce. Clean with an open kitchen. Will be going back.

After the chaos of the mall area and traffic this little gem of a spot was a real treat ! I has the gyro wrap (it's huge) and a homemade piece of baclava for under $10, spouse had the gyro salad-they don't skip on the giant fresh Pitas either! We'll be seeing you again...soon!!

We brought Mom here to celebrate her 95th birthday. The food is GREAT and the staff are accommodating.  Whenever we return we are remembered, and Mom is treated like family.  Our salads are custom made, since Mom and I can't eat green pepper; they are just like my grandma made in the 1950's!   The fish is grilled perfectly: flavorful and spiced just right.  The portions are large, and my family is happy because I am gluten free, so they get more of the special homemade pita that the restaurant is so famous for.  What I notice is that a lot of the EMTs and firefighters stop in for a quick meal. That is telling!  Yes, there is a few minute wait, but well worth it.    Ambiance is okay, its not a five star, but the price and value are great. Drink prices are $1.49 to $1.99.  The catering prices are a bit high, and they don't deliver, but I observe lots of people coming in for carry out.  Worth the drive from Sun City to Peoria.  Front view: http://www.greekwraps.com/images/wrapsshop.jpg
Plate menu: http://www.greekwraps.com/plates.htm

Food:  
Price: 
Location: 
Service: could be better... but hey, they're still nice, just busy... 

Overall, I would recommend it if you are craving for Mediterranean food...
Great food great prices great service!   I used to be a pita jungle fanatic, but greek wraps is now on my regulars list.
Great menu options. Slightly small inside but overall very good food. Good place to grab a quick bite for lunch or dinner. Hubby and I will be back for sure!
Simply the best gyro around. Tender, flavorful, yummy! Gyro salad is crazy!  Big enough for 2 to share!  This place is always clean and the staff friendly!

Can we say amazing?!? Greek Wraps sure can though! 

So I walk in to this little place in a strip mall with a random craving for falafel expecting to be disappointed by the food and service. Thanks to my fellow yelpsters I decided to give it a try though and thank goodness I did!! While the staff wasn't the nicest I can seem to care because the food was absolutely fantastic!!!!!!!!!

I'm almost sad that the portions are so large because I don't have an excuse to come back tomorrow...

Thumbs down. Not impressed. Almost $9 for a baby sized lunch wrap (and I ordered the big one) with rubber meat. Rather bland. Maybe my expectations were higher because of the quality Greek food in Europe?

Do one if three things - A) lower the price, B) give me a higher quantity of food, or C) improve the quality of food. If they did any one if these, I'd give 3 stars.

Since when did $9 lunches become common? That didn't even include a drink.

Chicken kabob wrap was really fresh and delicious. Chicken was tender and not overcooked like some places. 
Worth the wait!
I've been to Greek Wraps several times since I live nearby and I always have a great experience! The chicken kabob plate is where its at! Also, the staff is always friendly and helpful.

Man, I forgot how fresh and delicious Greek Wraps is! Took a long break from this place in protest following a phone order I had placed one night close to closing time that they somehow never prepared upon pick-up. I recall starving that night so I conveniently forgot about the joint for well over a year.

Until about a week ago. A friend offered to buy me lunch and brought up Greek Wraps. As a genuine garlic freak, I remembered that garlic sauce and happily agreed. Needless to say, although busy and bustling, my Gyro plate + eggplant app + tzatsiki was excellent! Generous portions of their amazing fare makes going to Greek Wraps (despite it constantly packed house) an extremely satisfying experience.  

The folks that run the place are mostly Syrian and quite gracious and accommodating. I highly recommend this establishment for all of the above. Just please keep it on the down-low as it's hard enough to find a vacant table as it is.
My family LOVED this place! The falafel pita and plate were amazing. Quick service and delicious food. We will definitely be coming back here!
Food is awesome. Wait is alright. But they really need a bigger place than what they have right now. But better to max there place out than to never sell much food in a bad location.

This place is AMAZING!! It's always busy when I come here but very worth the wait! I've tried many gyros places around the valley and this one is by far the best! It's very clean, and customer service is top notch!

Visited tonight...We ordered take out it felt very authentic.  We got the falafel pita, salad, chicken kabob pita, spinakapita, & dolmades. The falafels were ah-mazing....the best I ever had in AZ maybe even ever!! From NY, so a bit of a food snob! Salad was fresh and light!!! The spinakapita was also fabulous...(yum yum yum,is what my brain kept saying as I slowly ate them)....wish they would make this on a larger portion as an entree not just an appetizer! Daughter had the chicken and she really enjoyed it as well! I also tried the dolmades and they were good, not the best but OK. The guy who took our order was super friendly, actually all of them were. Good vibe!!!

We didn't order the gyro but noticed they thinly shave the meat off the spit too.

Great place and when I am out here in the area, I will definitely be back!!!
If you like greek food, this is the place to go. Good stuff!

This is my favorite Greek restaurant, and I don't say that lightly. I've been to many Greek/middle eastern restaurants all over the valley, but none compare. Unlike many other Greek restaurants with mediocre lamb, Greeks Wraps gets it right every time. Also, you never have to wait very long for your food here!

The two things that set this place apart from all the other similar "Greek" restaurants that have popped up in every strip mall are freshly baked bread and customer service. They offer wraps in two sizes, small and large. I would only buy the large size which comes with freshly baked bread baked right in front of you in a clay oven. Almost anything is good in the menu. The customer service is excellent so that you always feel welcome.

I just had the most amazingly delicious and freshly prepared food! Not only is this place always clean, but the STAFF is always smiling and so friendly and helpful. 

I drive 30 minutes from Anthem just to eat here and I am never disappointed.

The portions are so generous! Best value for my money by far.

Do not pass this place up!

fresh and clean, delicious food
exceptional service 
always busy
great customer service
The Greek style chicken was amazing...never had such great chicken! Mister had a delicious gyros that went down really quick. Highly recommend this place.

Clean, polite, informative and pleasant atmosphere and staff was great. The table was cleaned after each guests left, suggestions were made bases in my taste, price was fair, food was great!!clean and healthy.

I've found a new favorite Greek eatery in the Northwest Valley.

Fresh ingredients prepared as you wait truly deliver.  The decidedly un-ranch dressing tzatziki (hooray!) has just the right zing.  The lemon juice squeezed over the taboule gave the perfect finish.  And the shawarma... delicious.  For sandwiches, go for the larger "wrap" over the "pita" and take the leftovers to go; the tandoori-ed wrap _is_ that much better.

My eyes tend to be larger than my stomach, so I venture just beyond that 1$ mark; but there are certainly plenty of options within that price range.

Be prepared for crowds.  There isn't much seating room inside or out; I missed some table opportunities on my last visit and had to "borrow" a table outside from the establishment next door.  Regardless, I'm already looking forward to trying some more of the menu the next time I'm in the area.

Excellent food and service, they make you feel at home, I come here with my family at least once a month, haven't been disappointed yet, the food portions are more than filling and I usually have to take some to go, if you haven't tried it yet gather your family, friends, co workers and any and everyone who wants to eat GOOD!!!
One of my favorite places in Glendale. Great food- very fresh.  But bring your patience, food typically takes 30 mins. Best to call ahead for take out orders.

This place has wonderfully fresh Greek food. And they hand-make wraps for each sandwich - fresh when  you order. Love their hummus and all of their roasted meats. And the pita and wrap sandwiches are HUGE! It's always busy here and once you stop in and eat you'll see why.

Best place for gyros. Been going here for years and it is actually better than it was years ago. Haven't tried anything other than gyro plate and gyro salad and both are great. Highly recommended. Salad is huge.

Family-owned and operated.  Excellent portions, quality, and flavors.  Staff are always clean and courteous.  Really can't get much better in the area for the $.  Going back again and again is a no-brainer.

The food is amazing but the customer service is horrible. When they say they close at 8 it's 8 sharp and the last 15 min before closing is rushed it's sad that a place like
This can have such great food but horrible service

BEST GREEK WRAPS EVER ! I bring all new clients and friends to this place to show off what excellent wraps we have so close to my house. Staff is very friendly and after a few times of going there they will remember you by face. They always say thank you for bringing new clients in.

best greek in the west valley hands down. 

very nice and clean inside. friendly staff
Love gyros!  This place is very good and quick service is a plus.  I've had the gyro salad, pita, hummus, and I was not disappointed!  I will be back for the falafel.  ;)
First time here. I am very picky when it comes to falafel. This was top two in phoenix. Excellent gyro as well. Try it!

Best gyros I have ever tasted. Meat is delicious and I love the home made pita bread. So soft and warm. Employees are all so nice. I'm assuming it is a family owned restaurant as I have see the same employees there for as long as I remember. My husband and I love this place.
Love this place it is always busy, the employees ate always friendly, and the food always fresh and tasty.

The Atmosphere is great.  The inside is always clean and most times you can find Josh at the cash register.  Josh is a cash register ninja that always embraces special orders and makes sure the cooks know exactly how to prepare the dish ordered.  Hes always customer friendly and often delivers food to the customers table.  If no one is in line waiting to order you can usually find Him and the Young lady there cleaning tables and tidying up the place.  In all my visits to Greek wraps I've yet to be unsatisfied.  

Favorite Dish:
Gyro Salad, Double Meat, No rice, No Hummus, Extra Feta and 2-3 Tzatziki Sauce with a Medium Drink while dining in.

I have been coming to this location for years and I can say that not only is it delicious and affordable, but that it is CONSISTENT. 

First of all, the gyros are the best I have had in the valley. The Greek salad is crisp with the perfect ratio of dressing and toppings. 

Second, I have never had to wait longer than 15 minutes at their busiest times and never had to wait for a table at lunch. Food is made fast (within 10 min of ordering it's on the table) and correct to the order. 

Lastly, I have never had a bad meal here. Like I said, this place is consistent. Different Greek restaurants have opened closer to my home, but I still make the drive to come here!

Greek wraps makes the best shawarma steak wrap I've ever tried in town. I ordered the shawarma steak with 10" bread after reading all the reviews of how fresh that type of bread is and it was the bomb!!. The sandwich was full of juicy steak meat, veggies, and sauce. I was full after eating only have of the sandwich. The price for a steak shawarma wrap meal is also reasonable. The is going to be my to-go place from now on for the best Greek wraps in Phoenix.

The absolute best greek place in the metro phoenix area (including Scottsdale).  The food is always fresh and plentiful.  The only gripe I have is that they haven't yet added Greek Fries to their menu; however, if you request them they will make them for you (Greek Fries are french fries with feta cheese and a greek/herb dressing).  YUMMY!
A non chain in arrowhead and its yummy!  Try the flaming feta for an appetizer. Live that they have added a few bistro tables outside for additional seating and enjoying the nice AZ spring.
Very reliable Greek food in the West Valley. It's a very casual eat-in off of styrofoam plates or take-out. Try the chicken shwarma plate. The garlicky yogurt sauce is divine.

Have gone here several times and my favorite item is the Pita Steak Shawarma...it really doesn't get any better than this.  Well marinated meat and the flavor is fantastic.  Other items I have tried are the Greek chicken salad, Steak Ka-bobs, the fish...all excellent.  The salad dressings and the humus...all tasty.  What a great little setup for a restaurant.  Staff is friendly and restaurant is always busy...obviously the food is great and prices are very reasonable with good portions.  If you have a large party, you may not be able to sit together as this place is always packed...don't let that deter you though!

I know people from the family who owns this restaurant, so every time I go in there, I am greeted with a smile. I've been going here for the past 7 years and never once have I been disappointed. If your looking for a decent place to eat, and you love delectable gyros, then this is your kind of place.

I don't get all the wonderful reviews. I was really disappointed with the food and the 20 minute wait for one small salad and one sandwich. The house dressing on the salad was probably the worst I've had at a Greek restaurant and the steak sandwich was just ok. Can't imagine we'll be back.

This place is awesome!  I have a thing for falafel and it's pretty hard to find decent greek street food in this town.  I'm also not very adventurous when it comes to trying new restaurants. But when I saw they had falafel, I had to try it. I've tried the Gyros plate, the Falafel plate, the hummus, and several of the pita sandwiches. The large size pitas are huge. My fiance can barely finish and he's usually a bottomless pit.  The fries are crispy, the gyros meat is nicely done and the falafel is perfect--spicy/cumin-y but not overpowering, crispy outside, perfectly dense (but not too dense, ugh!) inside.  The hummus is some of the best I've had in Phoenix and the rice is really good, too, although it seems like they've changed it lately to be all rice instead of rice and fideo. The staff is very nice and the decor is clean and pleasant .  Thank you, thank you Mr Business Owner for opening this place. Keep cookin'!

Freshly made and delicious! The Fam calls me a food snob, I must agree. I do have high standards and they surely exceeded my expectations. I could get addicted to this place. Will be a regular stop for me.
Try the steak kabob salad. Yummy.
Cant go wrong with the chicken shawarma and the hummis is good. Staff is cool and down to earth. Restaurant is always very clean.
I love love this place! Friendly service and amazing food! Love the steak pita and their chicken is so tender. Highly recommend.
Best wraps in Arizona.they give a lot of food evry time never change the quality of the food.evry  things test really good

The food here is amazing. I moved here a few months ago and was looking for a good place to eat. In Arizona, there are a limited selection on where to dine. But this place definitely hit the spot. Highly recommended. 

Family owned restaurant with excellent service. Will be dining here again soon.

This place is my favorite place to order out from in all of Arizona. I'm super picky about food so I appreciate consistency, and I've never been disappointed. I eat here all the time, It's that good! Hummus is awesome, pitas are always fresh, and the meat is delicious. The staff is always super nice too, even if they've got a huge line and are up to their eyeballs in orders, everyone is always friendly and helpful. Love love love Greek Wraps!

I have to admit I kinda love Greek Wraps.  It's a little hard to say this because the high school  kids that run the place can be a bit much at times but I can't stop thinking about the food.

I've been twice in the last 10 days and i ordered a combo Kabob plate with lemon chicken and steak both times.  I thought the salad, rice, kabob, pita, and humus were all yummy.  The best part was that it was more like two meals.  The first time I went I had to eat the leftovers for breakfast because I was still thinking about them the next morning.  I went again last night and it was just as delicious as I remembered. (The high school kids were up to their old tricks but just think of it as dinner and a show or take it to go like I did.)

Large menu to choose from, food arrived  quickly and were kind enough to bring out to the table outside. That was a nice touch. 

Clean dining area.

The gyro I had was good. Solid, but not the best I've had.  There was just something lacking compared to some other gyros I've had. Don't get me wrong, I still liked it.

The hummus appetizer was good. The pita was a bit dry or maybe not quote fresh.

Overall, very good 3.5.

My business partner and I had been driving around for 3 hours that morning, and we decided that it was time for lunch. I had remembered seeing this place in the past when I had stopped by the Rubio's that is in the same center, so we decided to check it out. We arrived at around 12:30 and the place was packed...which I generally take as a good sign! We got in line to place our order and looked over the menu. We loved that the menu had pictures of everything...a major bonus! 

I decided to try the Beef Shawarma and she got the Gyro. We grabbed a table and waited just a few minutes for them to call our numbers. We both took a bite and loved our meals. I had never had Beef Shawarma, but it was delicious, tender and served with hummus and garlic sauce. I tried the Gyro meat, it was some of the best I have had. Everthing seemed to be very fresh, and the restaurant was clean.

I don't venture to that area too often, but next time I need to, I will try to make it around lunchtime since the menu had many more items that I would like to try!

Was in Peoria i think for the first time ever, jaja. Went to Ford to get a new car and found this nice little gem. Pricey but they dont skimp in the food.
Greek gyro was favorful.

Food is great!  Excellent really!  Also, the staff is super friendly and outgoing.  They are always helpful with pronouncing the words!

Only thing, the prices are a little steep and they charge for extra dressing and other things.  That's my only thing!  

Even with the high costs, it's worth every penny!

This inexpensive & casual restaurant has great food!!! I didn't mind ordering at the front and then taking my seat, considering the very reasonable prices. My mother had the kabob plate and I had a gyro, we also shared baba ganoush with their homemade bread. We liked everything except the steak kabob, though the chicken kabob was excellent. They also had a machine that poured over 100 types of soda, which allows anyone who doesn't drink soda to enjoy things like seltzer. This restaurant is a convenient choice for those looking to have a modestly priced, not to mention delicious meal.

Amazing food every single time I go and the staff is very friendly!! I go there at least once a week. My usual is the Chicken Shawarma Salad. Their salads are AMAZING! I also sometimes get the Falafel salad which is also amazing! If you like Greek food then this needs to e your new staple! So delicious! Every time!
The best falafel sandwich ever. I'd eat it every day if I could. If you want Greek, then go here. The food and price will not dissapoint. I'm so glad I just decided to walk in and get something.
Best gyro I've ever had! And I've had a lot. Better than the one I had in Greece. I wish they had hot sauce though.

I'm not a big fan of Greek food,
maybe if I was I would give 5 stars.
The only thing that I have tried here though is the chicken sandwich, pita thing. Sorry can't really remember what it's called.
But it was pretty good. They have this green sauce that is really good and very spicy which I love:)

I don't have anything negative to say,
except it can be kinda packed in their, but I know that everybody loves them.
So go give it a try.
Great great joint. Delicious food, friendly staff. Can never go wrong with a delicious gyro!!!! Way better than pita jungle!! I love the mom and pops feel of this place!!!
Great food! Excellent service! Very clean! Staff is always friendly and polite. Never disappoints.
Best in phoenix for fresh greek pitas and hummis.love this place. dont need a huge review this place speaks for itself.

This place rocks! Their Menu is very simple and if you want to customize it they are very helpful! The girl on the cashier was very sweet and helpful. I came here with my parents and since they have been here before on their recommendation I got the 10 inch chicken shawarma. It's a great bargain for your buck. They r fairly priced and give you enough to pack some and take home aswell. Also don't forget to get their homemade fresh hot sauce (it's green in color). 

The staff was awesome aswell. They were very attentive and accommodating. I would highly recommend everyone to go check this place out.

I guess I'm one of the few people who wasn't that impressed with this place. I ordered the gyro plate to go and some baklava. I don't know if my expectations were so high because of the reviews, but I just felt so underwhelmed after I dived into my meal. The meat was a little on the dry side but the hummus was pretty good. I do intend on going back because I would like to give a different dish a try. The customer service was pretty nice so I don't want to judge the place solely on that dish. I'll update my review if I hit the jackpot and fall in love with my next meal.
Love this place!! Always have excellent food! Wish they would build one in Surprise!!

Greek Wraps is da bomb dot com (wait, do the kids even still say that these days?)

They are consistently delicious. Had lunch with the girls there today and grabbed some food to go. The Greek salad was amazing. Lots of fresh vegetables. 

Okay, I'm gonna be cheesy for a sec!  This place is clean and the employees are happy and care about their customers. They act like they WANT to be there. 

Bravo for being the best Greek place, hands down.
Awesome. Very nice. My regular stop. Made to order goodness. Worth the occasional wait.

I was skeptical about trying this place. As others mentioned, it looks & sounds like your run-of-the-mill mall eateries. I'm so glad I did try it cause the chicken shawarma is DELICIOUS! I moved out of the area but will continue to make the trek to this place again & again :-p

Hands down best hummus and pita bread this side of town.  We usually get the gyros plate and split it. HUGE portions.  Super nice, fast staff.  Have been coming for years and years and have yet to have a bad meal here.  

If you're brave- ask for the spicy sauce.  It's fantastic.

I highly recommend this place if you are around the area. They have the best shawarmas. The garlic sauce adds to the magic! 
Absolutely love the chicken shawarma and the fish shawarma.
Best lunch I had all year! Chicken Shawarma was absolutely fabulous. Gyro and Shawarma salad were also extremely good. Highly recommended

Great Food! Overall service was Good! A little timely for just a gyro wrap. But I trusted that everything was fresh. 

No beer though. That is the only thing that holds me back from deciding this place or pita jungle.

I love this place.  People are really friendly.  GREAT FOOD.
I recommend Greek Wraps to anyone. I am vegetarian...  Salad is always fresh, Falafel is the best...
Thank you guys...
ben

I have been going in this nice and simple place for many times and can't even remember being disapponted because their food is really yummy, affordable and you will get out with full tummy plus you will say thank you The greek wraps for my good lunch :-) always recommended this to my friends.
Probably the best Gyros on the west side. They are a bit pricier than most other similar places, but it is worth the extra $1.50 for better flavor. I almost always stop by when I'm in the area.

By far, this is one of my favorites spot!! Any time I'm craving gyros, I'm here! I been having a lot cravings lately. Past 3 weeks, it has been once a week! My littlest toddler usually likes me to order the corn dog kids meal with fries, but I introduced her to the gyro plate and now it's the new winner! She didn't touch the corn dog after, instead it's older sister who finishes for her. She even eats the salad!  I love the balance in the dressing. I just wish there were olives on top of hummus and in salad, but hey! Either way! It's Delish!  My favorite is the gyro plate with rice, side of hummus and side of salad!  All the sides are big and I kill it every time! They are not shy with the meat!!! Mmmmmm thank you! The price is def worth what you're getting. 
Every time I visit, this place is usually clean and also busy and I can see why! They are genuinely nice folks behind the counter from their greetings to the goodbyes. It's nice to know that they are observant and with my little ones, they include and extra plate. Most places, I would have to ask but thank for you the convenience!
This place is amazing. Love the chicken kabob plate. They never disappoint!! Friendly staff & delicious food.

Just finished late lunch there. Quite surprised to see so many people @ 3 pm on a Sunday. 
First, the place looks clean and very much like what we are accustomed in Europe. Second, the menu offers many options to satisfy any hunger. Third, the staff if friendly. Fourth, the food is quite good. Got a gyros plate and never had this quality in Phx area before.
Overall, a nice little place if you want to experience a good Greek taste in NW Phx (reference: food tasted in Greece a few years ago).

I would have to say that this is the Hidden Gem of Glendale.  

I took a friend here from Atlanta and he still talks about it to this day.  He is always asking me to Fed-Ex him a gyro from Greek Wraps, and he is not kidding.  

The secret to this place is the homemade pita wraps ... incredible.  I will refund your meal if you go here and are not satisfied.

It's been about 10 years since I've had delicious falafel. The last place I used to go to for falafel on a regular basis was Hidyan Cafe in Boston's Fenway neighborhood. Man that place was good! Since I left that area, I was on a hunt for a replacement for a while but I eventually gave up. Then a few weeks ago a friend suggested we go to Greek Wraps. And guess what!...... I finallllly found the perfect place to fill the falafel void in my life!!! Yep - phenominal!!! You should go eat there NOW! And bring all your friends. They will thank you.
***Their hours are: Mon - Thurs 11a-8p, Fri & Sat 11a-9p, & Sun 11a - 7p

Tried, falafel sandwich with pita bread and it was just ok only. It was Saturday, so it was too crowd where order was taken fastly by the billing counter lady and i asked her for suggestion and no help. I would say customer service need improvement and especially handling on weekends.
I get the steak kabob pita and it is awesome every time. The fries are good. It is one of my favorite places to eat.

I just had dinner at this place for the first time.  I ordered the chicken schwarma wrap, which was fresh, hot, well-seasoned and served in a hot, homemade pita wrap.  My boyfriend, who is a VERY picky eater, was impressed with his gyro.  Overall, the meal was a great value and we will be back next time we're in the area.  One word of advice though...the portions are HUGE.  I ordered a 7" wrap, which was too much for my little stomach and my boyfriend's combo came with a mountain of hot french fries.  If you are a big eater or like leftovers, you will be a happy camper!
Simply the the best...love the freshly baked wraps you make the call on what to fill them up with chicken, gyros, shawarma or any of the many other options available

Best chicken schawarma in the valley! I liked it so much the first time i went that i came back two more times that same week. (Not kidding). I love this place. Its a great little hole in the wall.  I have brought countless friends to his joint and everyone has loved it.  If you like spicy food ask for some of their homemade green hot sauce/ salsa. It packs a monster punch and has fantastic flavor.  This place does Greek food right.  Eat here. I promise you'll love it.

I have been coming here for just over a year and the food is ALWAYS great! Fresh and lightly spiced, homemade humus, mmm! The staff is always super friendly and helpful. I've brought friends here who said they didn't like Mediterranean food and they fell in love. My personal fave is the shish kebab chicken with humus and saffron rice.

This place is great!  I literally eat food from this restaurant every weekend.  I am a huge fan of the Chicken Kabob plate (garlic flavor).  The humus is absolutely delicious.   I have always taken my order to go but the establishment is nice.  There is also some outdoor seating for those beautiful AZ fall and spring days!

I am interested in obtaining nutritional facts about the food though.  I have asked but no one can provide me with the information.  Regardless, this is definitely one of my favorite places for quick and delicious food!

Absolutely love everything about Greek Wraps. The food and service are always outstanding, and the restaurant is kept very clean and presentable. When I wasn't vegetarian, I loved the chicken schwarma. This restaurant is vegetarian-friendly, so I still have no problem getting great food.
May have just had one of the best Greek Salads w/gyro meat that I've had in a long time ....I'll be back to try something else very soon !!  Opah !!

Come here frequently and I was not disappointed once. Great service, they are always busy. There food is top notch quality and they spoil you with the amount given. The gyros wrap is my favorite and absolutely  love there salads.. And if you want a little bit of all there meats get the supreme kabob. Excellent!! So tender and fresh!
This was a great little place to grab a bite. The gyros are a good size and very flavorful. They get busy, so don't expect food to come out fast. It is well worth the wait though.

My family has been coming here for a couple of years. Consistently good and fresh food. Their pita is never dry and their meats are always flavorful. Good sides too! Wish they were open later than 8 pm though.

I've tried a handful of Greek restaurants here in town, including Pita Jungle which isn't too far down the street. This is by far the best I have had.  I had the "Steak Schwarma," which was huge! It came with rice and a side Greek salad! I am looking forward to trying other menu options!
Best gryo spot in peoria hands down. Not much needed to say but make your way to 73rd n bell and enjoy

We love this place it's one of the best places to eat in the West Valley. They are almost always busy and for good reason, the food is freshly prepared after you order, the portions are great and the prices are very reasonable. This place is family run and they are very friendly. Lots of options for everyone's diet accommodations, with many healthy food options. Great for dinner and lunch especially for post workout meals.

Amazing food! I always get the 10in wrap gyro and it never disappoints. The staff are friendly, the restaurant is clean, and the food is the bomb! When I lived in Arizona, we would have food from here at least once a month. So when I came to visit AZ this week, I decided to stop by. Still the best. Every time I go out for gyros, I compare other gyros to Greek Wraps. They always come short to Greek Wraps and I walk away from the other gyro place with my head held low. You can see a tear coming down my cheek and a hopeless look. Greek Wraps is like an ex-girlfriend that got away. You compare every girlfriend to her and the new girlfriend fails in so many levels.
Wide variety and great tasting food! Amazing Amazing Amazing!!!
Would have given five stars but for the loud rock music radio station. The food wad great and the service friendly. When the music got to us, we just moved outside.

I've been a loyal customer since I moved to the area 5 years ago. It's my number one spot in town for gyros. What sets them apart is the availability of getting a standard pita or a 10" wrap. The 10" wraps are hand stretched and baked when you order your sandwich. I've tired just about everything the have stuffed in the wrap...souvlaki, chicken shwarma, steak shwarma, gyro...and they are all delicious. The serving size is always more than enough and always served fresh. In fact, I think a trip to go get dinner may be in order!
The go to for Greek in this area of town. Always great food and service. Chicken Shawarma plate is always awesome and the Gyros are great.
The food is amazing here. I've been here a few times and love it every time. I ordered the gryro platter and it comes with a Greek salad and rice. I have to say everything was delicious.
Best shawarma, dolmas good, fries are average and so are the spanakopitas! Egg plant dip was above average.

Wooooo!!! I love gyros. I have had great ones, and I've had not-so-great ones. These my friend, were some of the best I've had. My lamb was tasty as can be, tzatziki was flavorful, I had to pull out some blah pieces of iceberg lettuce though. I'm just personally not a fan of the iceberg lettuce. The BF had the falafel pita wrap. The falafel was good too- spicy, even. I've only had falafel one other time forever ago, so I can't really compare it to another experience. But it was tasty. The atmosphere of the place was nice, I didn't expect it to be so "new" looking. You can watch the cooks prepare your food right there, and everything is made to order and fresh. It was busy when we arrived (about an hour before they closed on a Saturday), and it just kept getting busier. All-in-all, I will definitely be visiting this place again. Maybe this evening!

A friend recommended this place to me and I went for the 1st time yesterday.  I have had gyro's in many places in the west valley and without a doubt, these were absolutely the best. They have a 7 or 10" gyro, I was hungry so ordered the 10" - I could only eat half of it it was so large.  The meat was very tasty without being greasy and the pita it was wrapped in is home made goodness. I had rice with mine, which was okay, friends had fries & said they were very good.

Prices very reasonable for the portion size. Everything that I saw on peoples plates looked so delicious. I will absolutley go back, this was really a great find for me. Be prepared for a bit of a wait for a table if you go at lunch time, the place only has maybe 10 tables/booths available, though it does have some outside seating too.

Fantastic food!!!  Very fresh and tasty. Thanks for catering our event.

The food was hot and fresh and delighted our group of 50 plus!!
Always good service but the food is great sometimes and okay another. We'll keep coming back because of the people.

I tried the chicken kebab wrap and it was delicious. The meat was juicy and spiced perfect. The wrap bread they use had a good taste of its own. Can say that the chicken kebabs were one of the best i have tasted.

The food here used to be good. Now not so much. I've made a few orders for my falafel and each time it just got worse and worse. I decided fool me twice shame on me fool me 4 times....well enough is enough.

The food here is consistently the best Greek food in the Phoenix area. I'm not really a Mediterranean food person, but their wrap bread and chicken are so good I go here regularly anyways. 

However, be warned! This is NOT fast food. A routine order will take 15+ minutes, and longer when they are busy. 

The service is pretty good as well.

I really liked this place... Chicken Shawarma was great... Get the wrap, it's fantastic... Only thought was for the price I would have like a larger portion of fries. But all around I liked it and will be back!

Excellent little place for salads, gyros and shawarma. The food is always good and fresh. 

The service is always good and the staff has remained consistent over the years which leads me to believe the ownership and management are good.
Went here for lunch.  Had chicken kabob platter w salad. Lots of food and all very tasty.  Price was reasonable.

Had a Greek salad here since our regular Gyro place was closed.  The chicken was really good but the salad itself seemed a bit tasteless.  My husband said his chicken gyro was good.  The staff in the place were very attentive.  Made you feel at home.  Will probably return.
Great food, Fast service, Super nice staff! Ive been here twice and I really enjoy there chicken kabob pita.
Best beef Shawarma I've had in Phoenix! Best tzatsiki sauce I've ever had! They give generous portions of food! Greek Wraps is in my top 3 favorite restaurants in Phoenix.

This is probably the best greek food I've had in Arizona. 
They lose a star because it was overly priced per the proportions serviced.
This place is AMAZING! I ate the chicken kabob pita, and it was the best pita I've had in my life! Can't wait to go back.

We frequent this place at least once a month. It's the only good shawarma on this side of town. Good Flavors. Only complaint is the pricing. It's pretty high for this type of restaurant. We have a family of 6 and it usually cost us around $75 to feed 2 adults and 4 kids. Kind of steep for almost fast food.
I have a serious love for middle eastern food and this place doesn't disappoint. I've had the falafels, chicken and beef shawarma and gyro. All are amazing and very consistent.

Stopped in with my dad to get a meal and we were not disappointed.  It's not traditional, high end Greek food, but very good, solid mediterranean "fast food".  It was tasty, they had a lot of menu choices and it was quite filling with large portions.  We went on the early side of the dinner hours so it was rather quiet, but by the time we finished eating the business started to pick up.  It's wasn't too noisy, and the restaurant is pleasant.  I would definitely eat there again.

Every time I've had food from this place I am never disappointed. I had an excellent experience today when I went in to order food to go, the woman at the register was extremely friendly and efficient. I ordered the chicken shawarma pita meal with a side salad and a soda. It was pretty busy in there and several people came in after me, however I waited less than 10 minutes for my food to be ready to go. This is a place that I will frequent more often as I've never been disappointed with anything here.

If you are looking for a good and clean food, then this is the place to be at. I literally could eat there everyday. The place is always clean with a cool friendly staff. I am w big fan of pita bread and love the hand made 10" bread with any combination of meat.

Now I can see what everyone else is talking about! Place was pretty full around noon for the lunch rush! Everything on the menu looked delicious! I chose the Greek salad pita and it was excellent! Great flavor and very fresh!!!!

Yummmmm.  Yummmmmmmm.  And again, yummmmmmmmmmm.  Fresh and tasty.   XLNT service.  Friendly.   My first visit makes this my latest favorite !!!  Very flavorful.  Bread is my weakness (one of them at least) and this came to my table steaming hot and absolutely delicious.  Great job !!!
Consistent fresh food.  Super yummy, the kabobs and fresh bread are as good as it gets!   Don't forget the hot sauce!

Loved it!
Fresh food (I really liked being able to see it being made thru the glass) clean top to bottom & super personal service. Hands down the best gyro I've ever tasted... wonderful tzatziki sauce the meat was so tender & juicy. The price was about $10 and it was a huge spread of food. Much more they one person could eat. Rice, hummus, fresh pita and a salad. Everything was fresh & tasty.

Hosted by a male, dark short hair, thin... Maybe late 20's... When we asked, he mentioned it was his family's place.. He took a lot of pride in everything. He made sure everything was perfect with all orders, even catty-out. My husband and I felt as if we were sitting down to eat at a family members home (one that's a great host). He went ABOVE & BEYOND expectations. 

Only suggestion.... It was very apparent that the quality of products used were very good. From the thick plastic wear for carry-out to the awesome new coke machine with many flavors in the dining room...  definitely an A+. However, the Sweet & Low (a saccharin based sugar substitute) seemed out of place in a casual restaurant striving for high standards. A person that doesn't need to use a sugar substitute may not realize that there is a difference. Splenda is a little more expensive but I know when a restaurant carries it...  they have their customers in mind, not the 2 pennies per pack they'll save. There is a big difference in taste to a person that has to use it.  

Over all GREEK WRAPS is a great place with great food, We will return again. Definitely a value for the price. If you like Greek food you can't go wrong... it the best around!

I must live in a cave. I just discovered this place through a friend. The portions are BIG, the food is delicious, and the service is fast and friendly. My husband is wary to try new things. I said just trust me. Ordered him the combination kabob plate. He's been dreaming of it ever since. See you soon Greek Wraps!
A great independent spot! Delicious gyro, shawarma and humus. We try to get here at least once a month, and that's a 10 mile trip. Well worth the trip!

Great lunch spot, Always upgrade to the 10" inch wrap.
7" inch is store bought bread 
10" bread is made in house (delicious!) 

Suggestions:
steak shawarma sandwich 
Falafel sandwich.
The food is great never had a bad experience! Their staff is always kind and eager to help. Nothing compares to this Greek restaurant.

Just great! No question about this place at all. Fantastic and fresh, and it all tastes so good. We went back a couple of times during our visit to town just so we could try different things on the menu. Hard to say what is best, depends on your taste, but whatever you like it will be good.  Mostly because it is freshly cooked while you wait. Not super fast food but doesn't take too long either, and you can talk to them while they are getting your food ready. Love a place that makes it's own bread - so fresh!

Pleasantly surprised!! This place is so unassuming from the outside looking in. I've driven past here a ton of times and had no clue that they'd be a contender in my current Greek food binge. First sign: I walked in during a Monday afternoon and it was jam packed for lunch. I ordered the Chicken Greek Salad. Exactly what I wanted in a salad. I was really impressed to find this spot on Yelp! Clean, quick, fresh/quality food, and most importantly great service. Places like these are rare to find in the valley, the west valley at that where all you find are chain restaurants. Will definitely be returning :)
The service is excellent and the food is very tasty.  I love their 10" gyro wrap and their salad is fresh.  You wouldn't be disappointed

I won't lie, I was surprised at how good this place was. I really didn't think it would be. I got the combo plate chicken and falafel on the salad. The chicken is super tasty. Really tender and flavorful. The sauces, the tzatziki sauce is awesome. The hummus is awesome. I was just really impressed. Salad was solid too. Give this place a try, it's a pretty awesome.

There are many Greek and Mediterranean food in town, but Greek wrap it's one of a kind I have tried all of them I suggest for all of you to try Greek wrap. I have too much experience in foods so therefore take my advice and don't get confused with what to order, anything you order is good

I am very discerning of Greek food and cuisine and Ive been to many Mediterranean restaurants across the valley. Greek Wraps is delicious and has so many options. It's filling and left my whole family satisfied.

This place is just plain awesome!  People are friendly and the food is delicious and the prices are extremely fair!  So come on in and give it a shot...you won't be disappointed!  Let Josh put a smile on your face...he is hillarious!
I love this place! Food is always delicious and they never disappoint. Best Greek wraps in town! A must try!!!
The food here is amazing. They make their pitas from scratch as you order, the food is cooked perfectly and garnished beautifully.  Honestly the best gyros in the country from my experience.

I think I found a new place to get my " Gyro Fix. " I came here today for the first time. The restaurant was very clean, staff was very friendly, and the food was very good. I judge the quality of Greek places by how good their Spanakopita is, and theirs was one of the best. Their Greek Gyro was also extremely tasty. I will be back to try the rest of their yummy menu.

Really amazing Greek food.  The shaved meats are perfectly marinated in Middle Eastern spices, roasted to perfection, and shaved to order.  The meat is served on a bed of rice and a scoop of humus.  The portions are huge. Super healthy salads as well.  One of the best Mediterranean joints I have ever eaten at.

I have nothing overly detailed to add that other people haven't already said, but this place is basically my neighbor and I have only been there twice. 

Both times though I was really impressed with their quality, and got a lot of food for my money. Yum!
By far my favorite Greek restaurant!! The staff is super friendly, excellent food, and perfect location! Check them out, you won't be disappointed.

I grew up in Chicago (where the gyros is an art, lol). Phoenix had yet to impress me with a gyros, or any Greek food for that matter. When I wandered into this place I really wasn't expecting much, but WOW!
Very friendly staff that really appears to care about customer service & some quality "home made" food. We had the gyros platter & chicken kebob pita. Gyro meat was good. Tzatziki is obviously made on site. Hummus is also obviously made on site. Both were exceptionally good. So none of the canned garbage that the rest of the Greek places serve. Chicken was extremely juicy & quite tasty.
We will definitely go back!!!

When we used to live in Peoria, we would go to Greek Wraps about once a week. Their hummus is to die for. I've actually never had anything less than terrific there. Everything from the veggie pita wrap with grilled eggplant and onions smothered with their special yogurt sauce to their grilled lemon kebab with garlic sauce is amazing. 

There is always a line at Greek Wraps and expect a wait. The food is made fresh to order and the portions are plentiful. 

I wish they had delivery!

My wife and I both love Greek and Mediterranean food, and this place rocks. I mean... totally rocks! The food is always good, and the service is great too. If you have what you think is a favorite Greek food place in Phoenix/Glendale/Peoria, think again. There's a reason this place is always packed!

Best wraps ever!!!
I was here on Friday the 28th of September, and It was great!!!
The place, is modern, well-kept and clean, with lovely images of Greece all over their walls. 
   *** I decided to go with their Lemon Chicken pita, with the Cesar sauce and the works in veggies, it tasted extremely fresh and healthy to me!!!
BEST WRAP so far!!!! Oh so tasty and also well proportioned, I would love to frequent this spot, but its a long drive from my home!! 

** One day we will meet again!!! :) **
Really great wraps!! Friendly service!! We always get the steak shawema.. Great flavor, we also always get it in the home made pita not the other pita bread. So yummyyyyy

Food was good, it was very messy but in a good way! It was messy because the portion was full, some restaurants don't give as much, and customers pay more money than what they get. Not at this place! Service was great too, the cashier came and brought me my food when I was sitting even though it was a to go order. I typically don't experience this so I thought it was nice.
My coworkers and I are obsessed with this place! We go for lunch a lot and they're fast quick service is amazing when we're in a to go hurry :)

We live very close to Greek Wraps and frequent it often. I love local places close by. We do take out and sit down. I love the gyros. I would say the best I have ever had. My boyfriend loves the chicken shawarma. The rice pilaf is so good. The flaming feta appetizer is a hit as well. The food is always fresh and fast. The service is always top notched. We are blessed to have this wonderful place so close by.

sooo filling...we ordered the hummus appetizer(your average, creamy rich hummus), the tzatziki appetizer(tangy, cool yogurt sauce with green onions), and the flaming feta appetizer(fried feta cheese mixed with a creamy, spicy sauce...not awfully spicy--incredible), all of which came with pitas...

I also ordered 1 spanakopita to go with my falafel+rice plate)6 crispy, spicy falafel balls over yellow rice, into which I mixed tzatziki and hummus...mmmm...

Jamie had the shawarma wrap(massive, and with some hard-to-place spice that was absolutely tantalizing)...

I was definitely reeling after that meal :p

This is a family favorite for us. Great food and great prices. I am a fan of the chicken kabob-platter (although it is A LOT of food), pita (make it a combo with hot french fries), or salad. Lots of options! Everything tastes real, healthy, and flavorful. Good West Valley spot for Greek food!

Saw the amazing reviews but was dissapointed with the food. Got the kebab combo plate with beef kebob and some other beef. Both were very chewy and wasn't as flavorful as I would have imagined. The Pita bread and hummus tasted like it was from costco. The service is amazing but the food is just ok.
Loved this place. Had the gyro wrap with a side order of the fresh bread and some tzatziki sauce and everything was great. Wife had the greek salad with gyro meat and she really liked hers as well.
Has to be my favorite go to Mediterranean food joints.  Never disappointed and the food is always made fresh!

Best Service, Chicken & Steak kabob plates are our favorites!  Everything on the menu is great & fresh!  Service is excellent even though at times a little busier.  I always place my order ahead of time and have it ready to go.  Have the large pita bread, made fresh their!  Try it!

I love this place!  We've never been to Greece or have had "authentic" Greek food at a fancy restuarant but I have had falafal and gyros and New York City so I'm basing my comparison on that and I think this place is pretty awesome.

We used to love going to Ararat's Mediterranean (sp?) and now that it has closed, Greek Wraps is our new fave.  It's a ways drive for us since we live way out in Buckeye but anytime we are out that direction, we almost always head to Greek Wraps.  

We've had their falafel and gyro platters/wraps and enjoy them a lot.  I think the falafael is a little on the crunchy side but I don't know if it's more authentic for it to be "software" or crunchy like they make it.  Their rice is good, too.  My husband even picked up catering for his work crew and they all enjoyed it a lot, too.

The service is pretty decent, too.  Nothing fancy but they greet you and help you out of you ever have any questions.

my wife been after me to go to Greek Wraps forever, finally, we went last night, she had the Falafel salad, I, the streak shawarma, loved both to the extent of eating everything they put on our tray. I asked about the cut of meat for the steak Kabob,the young man that was expediting the food offered us to sample, although, it wasn't from tenderloin, otherwise, they would have to charge double, it was tender, delicious, and generous sample portion, the Greek Wrap offers  whole food made fresh, truly healthier eating option. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars, they can do little better with serving utensil, especially, the foam plates. we will defiantly be back again and again.    thanks for the hospitality

For shawarma, I'd eat here...but I'd try a new place first.

Let me first say if you don't know where this is...it is hard to find.  Landmarks would be: World Foods, Old Navy, Mattress Firm, Rubio's...it's in the back corner of the strip mall that houses these stores.

Alrighty.  Service is quick and efficient.  A chicken shawarma meal is $8.18 with fries & drink.  The fries were not that great - I'd guess frozen from a bag.  The chicken in the shawarma was excellent and the pita bread was extremely good.  The problem is the rest of the sandwich.  There was not enough chicken, too much sauce (it was very drippy), and overall, not that satisfying.

I would say that if I had gotten a plate of that chicken on its own with some of the fresh pita bread and some hummus, I could have easily given this place 5 stars.  But we're ranking them on the wraps, and when the food was wrapped, I would opt to try another place first.

This place is legit. I used to come here once or twice per week while in school... wish I could make it here more often now. Whenever I'm in the area I try and swing by for a meal. I love the 10" shawarma's, always solid. Order an extra tzatziki sauce.

I really like there food ... my only complaint was there falafel was eh,  other wise good food , decent priced huge portions... was crazy busy when i went on a Sunday.. I got the Gyro plate.. and Falafel and hummus ... took food home

Yummmm!
Had dinner here- Gyro plate, kids chicken kabob, shwarma plate.  All were delish!  Meat was perfectly cooked, rice was good, hummus was great, and the salad was amazing.  I would definitely recommend this place. Bathroom was clean too.

Every time I go into this restruant is always so busy. The food is delicious and one of a kind. But the service could use some inprovement ... When I ordered I wanted to get a gryo with fries the meal but the girl cut me off very quickly and didn't even try to up sale me to the meal so I had to go back in line to order my side. Also they call out number orders when they should give out table #s because its very hard to hear in there and I couldn't hear them yelling for any number over the crowd so having the table number would help people get there food faster. Lastly they did not quote me a time my food would be done for a Togo. I waited for 40 minutes to get my order not knowing when I  would get it. All in all good food poor service. Nice people just need to get things in order.
Very nice establishment! They didn't make me feel rushed for asking so many questions!! Second time eating Greek! The food tastes delicious!!!!
The staff is always friendly and helpful, the food is consistent, portions are huge, and most important of all the food tastes great!

Went for lunch on a Sunday and had a hard time finding a place to sit. I had 2 pita sandwiches. The Falafel pita and the Chicken Shawarma pita which were both huge. 4  large pieces of falafel with lettuce and tomatoes and a garlic sauce which was very tasty. The falafel passes the crunch on the outside and soft and flavorful inside test. The Chicken Shawarma was excellent. The sauce makes this pita outstanding. The pitas were pillow soft.  I'm looking forward to trying more sandwiches and entrees down the road.

If you're in the mood for anything Mediterranean, don't bother going any where else. We have ordered pretty much everything on the menu, and LOVED every single thing we try. Not only is the food delicious, the staff is always welcoming and friendly. Even after moving to the East Valley, we come back any time we are nearby and have yet to find anything that comes close to all the deliciousness this places holds.
First experience here at this location. We love Greek food, and this by far makes such wounderful food

Delicious! This place is always packed because, the food is delicious! Reasonable prices for the amount that they give you. The steak and chicken kabob plate is awesome and so are the falafels. Everyone is nice and the service is great. Highly recommended!

This place is bomb. So many choices. The gyro wrap is so good. Pretty sure that's home made taziki and home made bread wraps. The staff is super friendly. Restaurant is very clean. And the food is so dang good man.

Best Greek ever! My absolute favorite restaurant. We eat here once a week. The Greek salad with chicken is the BEST salad I've ever had. My favorite is the Chicken Kabob Plate. Love the hummus too. You get a ton of food (enough for 2 meals). You have to wait about 20 mins for your food but it's worth it!!

Wow.. I have been wanting to try Greek Wraps since I moved to Glendale in August.. finally did and it was AMAZING. Who thought you would find incredible kabobs in Glendale!! The hummus was smooth and creamy, naan was soft and warm, and the chicken on point!! I will definitely be coming back! The service was phenomenal.. so nice and welcoming!!
Amazing food with the Awsome Kitchen Managers in the Greek Wraps. Only thing Chiquito is missing but he'll be tomorrow here

First time eating here and it was really good. I went with the basic gyro plate. I love meats roasted on a spit! This includes gyro meat, yellow rice, salad, hummus, pita, and portion cup of tzatziki.  It is a large portion, two people could easily share one dinner. With a drink the total was $10 and change.

Gyro meat was very flavorful! I liked the hummus. The rice was a little greasy, but not too bad. There were plenty of people here, so that's a good sign. I look forward to eating here again!

My boyfriend & I love Greek food, always have. There are many Greek places in Phoenix so it's hard to find a good one. Greek Wraps is on the top of our list, Chicken Kabob Plate is seasoned well, although there have been a couple times when it was a little dry. Their rice is probably the best Greek rice I have ever had, I love the soft, fresh pita bread & the garlic sauce wraps it all together. The hummus is ok, not the best, not the worse but then again I love tomato basil hummus versus plain. The Chicken Kabob wrap with Caesar dressing is also amongst my favorite things to order here. My boyfriend loves the Greek Salad but always orders extra Feta cheese. They are always busy and the food is always fresh!

This place is great, been here like 5 times. My favorite is the chicken shawarma, the meat is so tender and flavorful and the fries aren't that bad either.  

I have also gotten their plates and let me tell you its a lot of food, enough for 2 people I think. Salads are huge too!

The staff here is very friendly and the food is amazing!! Best hummus I've ever had. I used to get the chicken shwarma salad regularly, but the chicken kabob is so well seasoned that I think I'm switching to their plates, so I can get their delicious hummus too.

The bread they give you with either dish is nice and warm, and there's a garlic (or maybe tzaziki? sauce) with it that is perfect. I take anyone who visits and loves this cuisine to check it out!

The food was fantastic! Fresh and delicious. The pita had the perfect texture and taste. And they had no problem cutting a wrap in half so that my kids could split it. Customer service was awesome. First time there, and it won't be our last.
Nice location. Good food. Fresh pita bread. You can't go wrong with this place. Busy during lunch time but it worth it.

Came with a few people for lunch and they had a good crowd.  Seating was tight but we made it work.   Menu was more authentic than pita jungle.   We ordered falafel, kabob combination plate, hummus, salads and the freshly grilled pita bread (which took a few minutes but was well worth wait).  Prices are very reasonable, portions are large and staff are friendly.  I am not from area but will return when return to the valley.
Food is great ! Service not so much , cashier was extremely rude when I asked if the kitchen would split my wrap in half she gave me attitude.

This place is awesome!!! Great food great service wraps are bigs and delish 
Hummus was outstanding. My daughter had the 7 inch pitta and I had the 10inch I couldn't even finish mine it was so big. Would recommend and plan on coming back soon the rice was amazing my son had the hamburger pita and he loved it overall great place

I went here for my first time on a Friday afternoon around 2pm. The place was pretty clean and packed. 

I ordered the Gyros plate for $10.44 with tax. It included: hummus, rice, gyro meat, one pita, a side of your choice (salad or fries; I got salad) and a side of tzatziki sauce. The hummus was good. The rice was addicting! The meat was verrrrrrrry juicy and tender. The pita bread was SO SOFT! The salad was okay. Kind of old. The tzatziki was really tasty. I was extremely satisfied with the amount and quality of the food!

Let's talk employees- they're SO nice. They made sure I was taken care of. They were patient with me. They brought me my food. They even gave me a compliment! On their downtime, I noticed they didn't just stand there. They cleaned the lobby while waiting for others to come in.

Job well done, Greek Wraps! I'll return :)

Awesome Gyro spot on the Weak Side!  

This place is legit.  We placed an order to go.  Tried the gyro plate and the grilled chicken salad with extra pitas and bread on the side.  

The gyro plate came with a side salad, pita bread, rice, and hummus.  It was enough for two people to share easily.  The salad was huge and came with some amazingly flavored chicken and also was enough for two people to share.

The pita bread was hot fresh and soft.  The tzatziki sauce was very tasty as well.

Some of the chicken meat was tough to chew but other than that this place was a great value and had great food.  

For everything and a tip we were well under 30 bucks.  I would come back and recommend!
Really great Greek food.  Love the gyros.  Wish we had a place like this in my hometown in CA.

Although it has a generic name, don't let that fool you. "Greek Wraps" has the best fallafel in the city. It's not dry or overcooked. It's seasoned perfectly. The shwarma is also the best in the city. The kebab is tough and overcooked. Their humus is good but not very authentic tasting. This is better than Spices in Chandler and Phoenicia in Gilbert. Their gyros are good but many places make great gyros. Go here for the falafel and ask for the chile sauce

I ordered the Gyro. Very good. 
Would have it again.
Workers are very friendly.
Place gets packed. Which reflects that the food is very good.
I also noticed a lot of to go orders.

Our family LOVES LOVES this restaurant!!  We tell everyone.  My daughter requested the chicken pitas for her wedding reception.  It was sooooo reasonably priced and every guest absolutely loved their dinner.  My husband is a huge fan of the chicken kabob plate... I love the Greek Salad Pita.  Their Falafels are the best around and the humus is to die for.  I could go on and on!  And the bread... oh the bread!

This is a great restaurant in a great location.  I've been here many times over the years, and stopped in for lunch when visiting a friend on a recent trip.  Their quality and service has not waned at all.  If you're near Arrowhead mall, and would like some great Greek food, you can't go wrong with Greek Wraps!
Great food , really great service , the gentlemen works at the cash register was very friendly,really enjoyed it !
Great food, poor customer service due to the rudeness of some of the staff members.
Great food and a nice atmosphere. I always get the 7" steak shawarma. Really damn good. The owners are really nice and the service is fantastic.

Hands down, best gyro I ever had. They were the first Greek restaurant I ever tried so I ventured out and tried other ones and those other places just don't seem to compare. Their food is delicious, portions are large, their French fries are crispy, and the workers there are super helpful and friendly! They also have a touch-screen soda dispensing machine (when I first saw one of these I thought it was the coolest invention ever!) The only disadvantage I see with this is that it slows up the time for customers to get their drinks since there is only one and there are so many options to choose from. Considering how busy it can get during lunch time, I think this could really hold up the line.


Otherwise, anytime I'm craving a bombastic gyro, this is my go-to place!

Pretty good hummus, incredible chicken kabob, and of course a gyro with beef and lamb steak is standard. It's complete heaven. The rice is okay, nothing too special. Atmosphere is almost like you're in a greek or turkish neighborhood getting your grub on and handling ya business. Coming here more often.
The best place in town bin here more than 20 times always perfect try the hummus and the fresh bread

Soooo good! I am only in Peoria when I need to go to my Acura dealership. I was going to get my back adjusted and there it was Greek Wraps! I have been told by a few people that it is a must go place. So happy I stumbled across it. The menu was awesome they are true to Greek food using REAL kalamata olives,olive oil, real feta,great tzaziki, shaved gyro which is the ONLY way to eat it (The pre-formed gyro is gross) and I believe homemade pita bread it was very fresh.At the moment I am not eating meat and usually that means only falafel at Mediterranean places but they had a very tasty and large grilled veggie pita they also had a fish pita and other non meat items! The employees a young guy and gal were also very friendly that is not always the case at a fast place they were patient answered my questions and had happy personalities. That alone makes me want to return with my family. I can't wait to try the meat dishes too! We need more places like this in Phoenix as they do all over the east coast! I wish they weren't so far away can't you move into the so called "Greek" fast restaurant on 20th & camelback that place is awful take us out of our misery!

I liked this place so much for so long! I ate there maybe once or twice a month, but after awhile I got tired of it. They have amazing food and is definitely something I would recommend to another person even though I am for sure sick of it.
Very good food,huge portion for the price. Steak shawarma with the hummus is amazing.

Ok but there are better places around.

Tried this today:

We liked the combo appetizer that included  2 falafels,  2 dolmas,  humus, and Baba ghanoush.  All these Items had nice textures and flavors.

However the chicken in the Greek chicken salad, while a nice amount (about 5-6 oz) was quite dry to the point of needing to drown it in dressing to be able to eat it.

The gyro salad had less meat (shaved very thin so it looked like a lot, maybe 3 oz).  

The salads (main meals and in the appetizer) was basic with a basic dressing on it - nothing special.

The baklava was in a cooler with drinks (other places serve it room temperature).  The fat  had congealed some so it tasted greasy and it had a flavor like some of the dough was not fully cooked. Too bad as I think it would have been quite good if not served cold - nice amount of nuts, sweet but not too sweet, and the top layers of phyllo dough were flaky and crunchy.  

We also get the prices were on the high side considering the amount/quality of food we got - $10 a plate when I would have expected the prices to be closer to $8 for what we got.

Greek Wraps is good.  I've been there a number of times.  The food is always fresh.  I've never had bad service.  Sure, the place is a little small for the business it gets, but you deal with that.  It's just....this place never wows me.  It's fine for greek food (something that, in general, has never impressed me) but it's just nothing special.

If you do go, the one thing I can say is worth trying is their hummus.  It's pretty solid and goes great with their fries.  I'd recommend only getting that if you're with company though.  It's a lot of hummus to eat alone (trust me, I tried).
Great place with delicious food! Super clean with a friendly and helpful staff. Try the falafel!
UPDATE:   Soda now tastes delicious.  They must have put in a purifier.
The food is quite good and the staff are very friendly.  They are a bit overpriced, (hence the 4 stars), but overall a great place to eat.

Great Greek place. There is a pretty large menu with an array of items to choose from. They are relatively inexpensive. I really like their shawarma! One of the cool things about this place is they have one of the large coke machines with 100 flavors in it. I love it when I can get cherry vanilla Dr. Pepper!

This place has the feel of a small mom and pop shop. They have a pretty good number of tables and chairs inside as well as a couple of tables outside. It was pretty dim inside because they had the big shades down over the windows. I wouldn't mind a bit more light in the restaurant though.

When this area gets busy you will be parking further way from the restaurant that but it's just a short walk. Nothing to worry about.

The staff are attentive and are there to do their jobs but I don't think they would want to talk to you more then they have to.

I would recommend this place to try out. You have got to try the shawarma!

I am officially addicted to their fresh bread and hummus. I wish I can get more than one fresh bread per plate (even you are willing to pay for it, you can only get one) this place is always busy for a good reason. A nice size outdoor space where you can bring dogs.

Wow! I stopped in here for lunch while in town on a business trip.  First off, the staff is great smiles, talkative.... Felt welcome.  

Splurged and got the supreme kabob plate.  Everything on the plate was great!  Chicken was juicy, steak was tender, beef was flavorful.  Their tzatsiki sauce was awesome but bring gum, they load in the garlic!  
Big portions for a great meal under $15 bucks.  I wish we had one of these back home!
Very good steak gyro wrap! The bread was the best part and tasted fantastic! My new gyro spot in az. Also it's a good amount of food given so you're full when you leave

I went to this place based on the reviews here.  It has to be one of the best Greek places I've ever been to, and I've been to a lot.  The portions are HUGE! you won't go home hungry.  Great menu selection, great food, great everything.  I thought Pita Jungle around the corner was the best, this place blew it away.!

Been here many times now.  It is our go to for gyros and especially gyros / greek salads.  

The staff is friendly and customer service is their goal.  Though they are not all family, it sure has a family feel.  

Nice clean business, can get a bit busy and noisy at times, but it is a gyros shop, you get what you came for.  We come often after church on Sundays (12:30 PM) and it can get busy and a line forms.  For me that means it is a good place.

Stopped in here after getting a massage at Hand and Stone. It is as delicous as the reviews sat! Had the 7" gyro.. Food arrived fast!! Meat was well seasoned and packed the grittiness of other gyro places. Tziki sauce was great and had just enough on the gyro. Service is friendly and exceptional, they even came by again to make sure we were happy which speaks volumes in a semi-fast food kind of place.  Will come back again!

Authentic, fast and flavorful. In the Valley of the Sun there are a lot of great places to eat , this jewel is one of them. The food is fresh and healthy and the menu is big enough to make even the picky break down.  Located in the West Valley on Bell just east of the 101

I really don't understand how his place didn't get 5 stars. This is the best Greek food in Arizona. They cook everything fresh every single day. Every Time I come into this place it is packed, and the staff is super friendly. The food is excellent! The meat is always seasoned to perfection, hummus is fresh, and their bread is perfect!! I don't know how people to go other "Greek" places, and enjoy it. The owner is a wonderful person and because it's family owned that means you are always getting too quality. I used order big orders for my workers and not once have they mess up, given me the wrong thing, or forgot anything, and this was at lunch time so it was packed yet they took time to make everything perfect. Every time someone asks me where we should go eat I always say Greek wraps.
Love this place! The best Greek food in town! And the customer service is always great too.

This place is always the go to when you're feeling for some wraps. I always get the lamb, steak or chicken... Mostly chicken shawarma pita! Full of flavor and meat is hardly over or undercooked, it's perfectly juicy. We used to live around the area but we still drive out from 20 minutes away to get the gyros here because it's totally worth the drive! 

We've also tried their home made pita bread, it is 50 cents or so more than the regular pita but it's really good. Definitely worth the try for a few cents more.
This place is so good! I love the pitas, homemade! The people are always so friendly, service is quick and food is always hot and delicious!

Ah.. really really awesome!!! Would recommend it to anyone. I have been looking for shawarmas and wrapsfor quite a while now.good thing this place was close to my hotel. I love the chicken kebab, the hummus was perfection, the pita bread warm and soft. Definitely a 5 star!

Ate there for the first time today!  We ordered gyros and fries! Everything was good! It is quite a ways from our house but if in that area, would like to visit again and try other things on menu! Prices are reasonable and everyone was friendly!  Tables were kept clean and food looked and smelled wonderful! I would recommend to friends to try this place!

This place has some of the best..if not the best Mediterranean food I've had in Arizona. I'm from a state that quite a bit and this is much better! I highly recommend the food. My only problem is the tone/ rudeness I've experienced with some of the staff members...when trying to get a discount ( I've come on more than one occasion) I'm asked for my ID over and over. Sure that's not a problem but the tone with which it's done is what is very off-putting. Definitely a place to check out though.

After waiting 40 minutes for my food I asked the manager for a refund. She gave me my refund and said thank you for your business. I said you didn't get my business. There were several other people that waited over 45 minutes for their food and this lady did not offer any incentive other than saying I'm sorry. And then she spoke about in her country. We live in the United States of America this is our country. If you are not from America then go back to where "your" country is if you do not want to be an American. I served in the Marine Corps for the freedom that everybody has in this country. This is my country and it is the country of anybody who chooses to live here. If I wanted to live in Greece I would say that Greece is my country because it is where i call home. But because I live in America this is my country. If you do not want to be an American, please feel free to leave just as you have freedom to live in this great country as well. I will never go back to Greek Wraps again and a one way trip back to her country! I wish there was a way to give 0 stars.
