What more could I ask for?! How about awesome conversation with the staff while enjoying my scrumptious shawarma? Austin, Martin, and the really sweet girl (whose name I didn't get who I thought was Martin's sister) were so awesome! They created such a warm, welcoming, family atmosphere that I felt like I was eating at home with family instead of at a restaurant. I mean, we even started having a conversation across the restaurant as Martin was tidying up and cleaning tables (didn't want to hinder him from working). 

Also, just an observation: I really appreciated seeing the pride that everyone had in working there -- it's difficult to find people that take pride in their work nowadays. Nobody was "too good" to help clear off tables and wipe them down or take an order. 

Thanks again for the incredible food and amazing experience! I will most definitely be back... And you're welcome, Martin, for telling you to find me on Yelp; you'll remember my name now (Hopefully). Haha!

Cheap, local, delicious.

I now officially have a place to satisfy my gyro fix in the west valley.  Its a small hidden spot on the southeast corner of 75th Ave. and Bell that I've driven by thousands of times but never noticed until I consulted the yelpers.  To those of you who reviewed this place, I owe you one.

She got a 7" pita, I got a 10" gyro.  First off, my gyro was huge.  I never been so full from a gyro in my life.  Second, its true what the other yelpers say about this place.  All the food is made fresh right in front of you, which means its usually about 3-5 minutes until your order is ready.  The wait is worth it.  The gyro with two kinds of meat, lettuce, and veggies is booming with flavor.  Despite its sheer size, I demolished it.  Not as quickly as she demolished the pita, but she had a smaller portion so I'll call it a draw.  We both were more than satisfied.

The place is small and was extremely busy (on a Sunday no less), but the cooks worked pretty quick.  Meals are usually $5-$10 tops.  Mine was $8.  Probably wanna get here early for lunch as I'm sure its a zoo.  And yes, they have baklava too (though I didn't try it this time).

If you're in the Arrowhead neighborhood and need a Greek fix, you'll be hard pressed to find a better place than this.  There's few Greek spots around here as it is, but I'm proud to say that this place measures up.
Delicious Mediterranean food! Portions are huge and the meat is delicious, so well seasoned. I got the supreme kabob salad and would definitely get it again.
Much better than the gyros at the fair!  Lamb was tender, and definitely not skimpy. Fast service and clean fast food Mom & Pop.

This place is great! I go here every time I am over in that part of town. I have tried the gyros and the greek salad with chicken and both were excellent. The pita bread on the side came out nice and warm. Never had a good meal here always an excellent meal! I wish they would open a location in the east/north valley!

I have no idea how I have managed to avoid this place for so long. I worked RIGHT across the street from Greek Wraps for 6 years and never made my way over. This will be one of my greatest regrets in life because this is some of the freshest, friendliest, most delicious food I have had here on the Westside! The staff was super friendly and helpful. I am not super familiar with Greek food so they pointed me in the right direction. I knew one thing, I wanted a "gyro," and one of the best decisions I made was to listen to the guy at the counter when he said "I recommend the 'wrap' instead of the pita" He said the wrap was made fresh, they take the doe, put it on the hot plate, cook it, then wrap your food in it. It was SO GOOD! I ended up with the Steak Shawarma. The lettuce, tomatoes, onions, steak, and of course the wrap were so fresh. The meat was crazy flavorful and not grisly at all. There was just the right amount of hummus and garlic sauce. The portion was huge. I ended up taking 1/2 home, as they said I would. I also gave the Falafel with Hummus Dip a try. The Hummus was velvety smooth, not lumpy or grainy. The Falafel was fresh, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was the perfect way to start my meal. 

I am pretty sure this is going to be my go to spot for a fast, good, very affordable, fresh meal from now on. This will be where I try all the Greek food I can for the first time. I cant wait to show my family this place and keep trying new foods. I am really disappointed in myself for not giving this place a try sooner. I have been missing out for sure. Not any more!

Great food, great value. I went basic with the Gyro combo. My wife had the beef shawarma plate. She said it was amazing and a lot of food for $10. The classic Greek salad was terrific. I would definitely come back and would recommend it to all.

Most amazing Greek food I have had and the service is absolutely on par all the time! I tried My Big Fat Greek Express at arrowhead mall, the service was so horrible so i came over here and they completely made my day! Thanks Greek Wraps!
By far the best Greek food! I have tried other place and they just do not compare, this place actually gives you large portions. I have had the chicken kabobs, chicken shawarma, and the  gyro wrap!
Some of the best Greek food I've ever had. Super fresh and not too expensive! Plus a lot of food for your money!
One of my favorite places in the Valley. Tip - you must order the made-to-order wraps (vs. the pre-made pitas).
This is one of the best Greek fast food restaurants that I have eaten at.  Customer service is excellent.
This is my favorite Greek place. I think it is family run. The food is fresh and delicious and staff is super friendly. Their Gyro and Greek salad are the best around!

This place is good!  The food is well prepared so expect to wait for your meal than have it whipped out in seconds.  The portions are huge so come with an empty tummy.   Everything was fresh and tasty.  This place is packed for a good reason!

Phenomenal food- whatever you order!
Chicken salad is awesome, beef shawarma is excellent!

Okay, so this review has been a long time coming. Not sure why I haven't written one in the more than five years since I've been coming to Greek Wraps, but better late then never. I LOVE this place. I've had Greek, Turkish and various Arabic cuisines in many cities and several countries, and the stuff they serve here is right up there with the most flavorful I've ever had.

Primarily, the fact that they make their own bread fresh to order is what gets me salivating when it's coming close to lunchtime. They have 7" pitas or thinner 10" wraps. I get the latter. They're delicious. I'll either get a chicken kabob or shawarma wrap, typically with a side of falafels and a side of dolmas (vine/grape leaves). Their vine leaves are the cold vegetarian versions; none of that disgusting hot stuff with pine nuts and meat. Falafels are excellent - they don't taste store-bought and sludgy but have great flavour with a very nice, subtle peppery aftertaste. The shawarma is fantastic - marinated enough to give it a delicious zing. Me eating a wrap is like putting a piece of paper in a shredder - I absolutely decimate the thing nonstop from start to finish and have to watch out that I don't chew my own fingers off towards the end. I've had baklava once or twice from here, it's not too bad either. And thank god they don't serve ridiculous Chicago-style hotdogs here. Last I checked, Chicago wasn't in Greece.

Greek Wraps has always been extremely popular, especially at lunchtime, and it was always way overcrowded. The "Jersey Shore" (cracked me up) dudes prepping the food work pretty furiously but still it takes quite a while to get your meal, sometimes 10-15 minutes or longer. Toward the end of last year they did a MUCH-needed renovation and pretty much doubled the interior space - I remember walking in and then doing a doubletake since I didn't recognize any of it. Even with the added space it's still almost always full up at midday. Great prices, the absolute best Mediterranean take-out on the west side (I like Pita Jungle equally, but that's a different range/style of foods) and well deserving of your cashola. For dessert, assuming you have room (typically unlikely), you got your choice of a Jamba Juice or a Juju Berri in the same strip, or else walk across the carpark to Cost Plus World Market and pick up a coupla import chocolates like Milka Nussini or Cadbury Flake. Mmm.

Edit 20110615: BLEAH!! T Greek Wraps now stocks the infamous Abali "yoghurt soda" which I first tried at Haji Baba's down in Tempe. Disgusting - BUT!! I was super excited to see it and actually bought a bottle to drink. Do not ask me why. I grimace every time I take a swallow of it, but maybe I like it because of the Warhead effect - some sort of mild endorphin rush you get from challenging your taste buds to something they aren't thrilled with. Anyway, add another imaginary star to my review just for this stuff alone. See my pic. http://j.mp/jIYTCK

Best little diner in the North Valley.  I discovered this place when a co-worker (from Greece) told me that this place served the best Greek good this side of Athens.  That was about 6 or 8 weeks ago and since then I've been back to this great little treasure about 5 times.

Wow, I do not take the time to write a review almost ever and when I do I don't remember ever giving 5 stars and I did for this restaurant. Very nice and friendly staff food is delicious. I'm stunned on how well I was treated and how good the food was definitely will be recommending this place to co workers friends and family
The staff was very helpful in explaining the different types of food.  I've had the beef shawarma and the gyro.  Both were excellent.  Love the Greek salad.

If you are a vegetarian, they have a veggie or Greek salad gyro. I got the Greek salad one and it stated great. The eggplant was good and the kiddo liked the falafel. Which is a miracle since he he is very picky. The pita was fresh, warm, and soft. The best type of pita. Great place that anyone that loves Greek food should try.

Casual atmosphere and relatively fast service. Come early or call ahead as it gets busy at lunch. My husband had the original gyro plate which he was very happy with. I decided to try something new which backfired on me the sharwama. Too many spices for my tastebuds ! Usually I like this dish elsewhere and I'm used to middle eastern spices this was just an overload of spice without harmony. Everything else was excellent though and I enjoyed the owner cashier very much!! I will return and just try a different dish :)

The food and service here are great. There is a nice family atmosphere and it is easy to tell that great care is taken in preparation of the food. It's clean and the decorations within the dining area are simple yet modern. The people working at the restaurant are very nice and I'm definitely coming back here.

I LOVE this place! Great food! Their hummus is delicious and lots of food with every order!! My whole family loves it. We usually get the chicken shawarma plate and the gyro plate. That feeds four people. The only thing weird is they give you a number for carry out (over the phone) orders rather than give them your name and I'm forgetful so I always forget my number by the time i get there lol

this place boils over with flavor!  The chicken shawarma pita!  That is all! Tell em to make it spicy! and get the 10''

Seriously soo good though, I love the ethnic flavor here, it permeates through the front doors.

Plus you know a place is good when you see a bunch of cops and firefighters eating there on their breaks ;)

We love this place! My hubby and I share the gyro plate. Its so big and has so much meat for us to share it! Very filling and we like that it's a healthier alternative to a lot of the fast food joints around and for $10 for 2 people it's affordable. Meat is juicy, rice is fluffy, my hubby loves their pita bread and I love the greek side salad.
This place is great! Been here 3 times in two weeks. The food is good, service is friendly. Would definitely recommend.

I'm from Los Angeles, CA and found this place to have some really yummy food! The customer service provided by Angelina great! She was super sweet and helpful which made our dining experience awesome!

Ok..lets start with yum, add another yum and end it with yum yum yum. Small place, looks clean, and very busy for Saturday at 5:30pm. Always looking for a middle eastern restaurant, don't let the name Greek Wrap full yea. It's ALL Middle Eastern. order shawarma wrap, rice, and fries. Don't judge it's my cheat day and I am hungry. Service was great thanks Angela, appreciate the smile and warm welcoming. The food turned out amazing, seriously I mean amazing. Keep in mind my orders come with do's and don't and they got it so right! Make sure you try out this place. It ended with a big YUM!

This was my first time here and let me say it will not be my last. I arrived right when they open and they all ready had people waiting for their food. The staff was nice and helpful.  The place was very clean and they have plenty of flavor enhancers such as olive oil and vinegar but it is not needed because the food is tasty as is. I ordered the gyro pita with a side of salad (other side options where french fries or rice). The pita was delicious but just a pit salty to my liking. The meat was nice and tender but with a nice crust on the outside. It seems that they cook it on a rotating spit. The salad was also delicious with a nice simple greek dressing and feta. They messed up my order by giving me fries but right away correct it by giving my salad and also the fries. The fries were good and basic nothing special. They have a nice full menu to choose from and have one of those new digital coke machine with many different drink options. Next time I will definitely get one of their salads they look great and were a good portion. The restaurant got pack 30 min after they open that is a very good sign. Thank you for a happy full belly.

This place is AMAZING!

I was a little confused on how to order when I walked in because it was so crowded. I thought it might be a sit-down type of service. However, you do have to order from the counter up front.

The cashier was very friendly. I told him it was my first time and he told me what was good. I went with the Supreme Kabob plate ($14). It comes with chicken, beef and another one that I wasn't sure what it was. I ordered for to-go because they closed in 20 minutes and the tables were all filled up. My food took about 15 minutes and I was off!

When I got home and opened my to-go box, WOW. There was HELLA food. All of which was delicious! I didn't finish it, so now I have lunch for tomorrow!

Keep up the great work! This place rocks my socks.
Delicious! Great prices...wonderful people and service...a quick and delicious lunch! Always busy but they get your food to u quickly! We go here frequently for lunch hour and never have complaints!
In a wasteland of "Friday Mc Charlie Something Or Other" chain restaurants, Greek Wraps is fresh, good food from some nice people.

Great service and even better food! This place is a hidden gem. Iv tried several different entrees and haven't been disappointed yet. The only thing that sucks are their hours. Sometimes they close pretty early. But I guess family is important to them so you can't be too upset about it. Try it, you'll like it.

I was so excited to try this restaurant while out from LA to visit my sister. It had great reviews and I was pleasantly surprised to see how packed it was upon entering the restaurant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We ordered our food "To Go" and we didn't wait too long for our orders. 
Regarding the food ... The Tabuleh was too coarse and chewy with a heavy olive oil taste that I did not expect; the hummus and spanakopita were meh; the falafel patties were dry and  flavored with curry which  I have never tasted before in a falafel patty and am not sure I like; the tzatziki sauce tasted more like mayonnaise than Greek yogurt with no dill or cucumber flavors; the handmade bread is probably best eaten there because it was very chewy and tough as it got colder ... and the worst yet, they did NOT pack my dessert! The 
Overall, our food was ok ... Not great. I think the meat dishes are probably better though I don't think I'll be coming back regardless.
Love them. Food is always good and fresh. Our order has always been as placed and we've always received wonderful customer service.

I've been here before and I remember it being good.

So today when I was starving, (I'm pregnant) and I didn't know what I wanted to eat and grouchy out of my mind I decided I wanted to come back and eat some Greek food!

I ordered a hummus app- delicious!
Perfect amount for 3 people I'd say. Hubby and I went to town and there was still some left.
We also ordered a beef shawarma combo on 10".  yummmmmmmmmm! 

I also got a gyro on 10" delicious!!!
The only mistake being is I didn't add feta on this. They're feta is amazing!!!
Very nice waitress. :) we'll be coming back!

This is my typical go to greek place that consistently delivers good food at a reasonable price. 

My usual order is the steak kabobs which are tender but also has a nice char on the outside. They also have fresh bread which is amazing to use as a wrap for the kabob.

The service here us usually quick and from my experience, generous. Occasionally they'll give extra fresh bread or add a salad when you didn't order one. Definitely a plus for extra food!
Always awesome, great service, delicious food! Good price! I always get a pita gyro with extra tziki sauce (sp?) And fries!! Addicted!

We're on vacation in Peoria and my wife wanted greek food on a whim. This just happened to be the closest place to us, but I'd definitely drive across town to eat here again. We ordered small Gyro and the Gyro Plate. Man, $6 for the small Gyro has to be one of the best deals out there! It's so meaty. My wife enjoyed her Gyro plate as well. The tzatziki sauce was very delicious, and the veggies that came with each meal were fresh and vibrant. The only thing constructive I could say is that the rice is a little under seasoned.
FORGET PITA JUNGLE. I know i have 5 star reviews for the, but this is so much better!  Chicken Schwarma was BOMB!!  I will be making this a weekly or biweekly thing with my Girlfriends daughter.

2nd time in 2 weeks ordered gyro plate to go and received wilted, slimy salads!  So gross.  Very disappointed! Also, ordered the large flaming feta appetizer both times and only received 1 piece of pita bread.  Management must have changed...greed!

If you desire a fresh break from Arrowhead Mall's Food Court this might be your destination as all the food we tried seemed fresh and prices seemed very low.

This is casual dining. You order at the counter and the food gets ran to you.

 They advertise they bake their own bread and that is usually a sign of a better place.

I tried a Combo Appetizer so I tried a variety of things. The Dolmas were good and the salads were fresh. The Eggplant Dip had way too much tahini in it so much that it was overpowering and heavy for my taste and lacking of eggplant. I prefer eggplant dip when you taste the charred eggplant flavor. The Falafels lacked fresh herbs and tasted very flat but were edible.

I should have complained about the Iced Tea. It was Brown Water. My husband tasted it and said it tasted like water too. I was afraid to drink it and was very thirsty.

The bread was fresh and seemed good.

Overall not the worst and not the best but better than food court food.

Super delicious food that doesn't leave you feeling heavy or greasy. I'm never disappointed and end up here at least once a week for lunch. Everyone I've brought here always leaves happy. Only reason I don't give it a 5 is because it can be pricey for lunch. 10 bucks for a plate. But again, I love it too much to say no.

I had the Gryro. It looked better than it actually tasted. It was very bland and was surprised they didn't have any good sauces to throw on top. When I bit into it, all I got was mouthfuls of ranch dressing. The pita was pretty good, unfortunately it was the best part of the gyro. The french fries were really undercooked, and bland. Very friendly staff, nice relaxed feeling inside.

By FAR the best Mediterranean food in AZ. I live in Chandler, and will drive 40 minutes just to get this stuff. All the meats are flavorful and juicy, the rice is soft and the pitas are hot. Hummus is also kickass! Place gets pretty busy, so make sure you know what you want when you go in! This is probably my favorite place to grab a quite bite in all of AZ. I wish I could give it 6 stars!

One of my favorite Greek restaurants to eat at. My very first time was last summer with my friend. We were taking classes during the summer and decided to eat here. She had been before but I hadn't. Then I went again with my boyfriend these last couple times. And this last time was my favorite because I discovered my favorite dish. The steak shawarma sandwich. It was sooooo good! If you don't like steak, there is a chicken version of this. Oh and I found out one of my friends from elementary school works here which is really cool. Good food and friendly pekoe. :) the steak shawarma had some type of seasoning that reminds me of Indian food. Not only reminds me but they use it in Indian food. I just don't know what it's called lol. Definitely recommend this place!

Their food is amazing. I got takeout on my last visit to AZ, and everything was fresh, hot, and so good. Their pita is fresh made, and worth the visit alone. The hummus tasted very fresh and zesty. I wish I lived closer, I'd be eating there weekly!

Loved the wraps here! The food was delicious and sooo fresh! The salad had the freshest veggies. The chicken shawarma was cooked to perfection . And to top it all the customer service was excellent. I will definitely be stopping by here the next time I'm in Phoenix area.

Love this place!! I always get the chicken shawarma plate and it is so much food. It has lots of chicken, hummus, rice, and a salad. I think it's about ten dollars. Everything is so flavorful and fresh! They people who work here are always very friendly and make sure you have everything you need. They always get busy around lunch time so I would recommend calling in if you are in a hurry. Love this place!

Love this place! Never disappoints. Even my Greek food hating husband loves eating here. 
We moved close by about a year ago and eat here at least twice a month now. Food is fresh and well made. Great quality food and the staff is really friendly. Little bit of a wait for your food, but it's worth it.

Amazing food here.  Love coming in for a Gyro on my lunch break or when I'm getting off work.  Pretty quick, super fresh and healthy.  Very authentic too, I love it.  I'll be back soon for another gyro!!
This place has some delicious wraps,the chicken kabob is my fav.the kids menu has a good selection as well.

Wow! 
Three letters, and only one vowel does it a disservice! 
Marking this in my repertoire as another great Yelp! Find! 
We had the hummus, falafels , gyro plate and mixed kabobs. 
All a home run, and We'll definitely be back!
Lots of foot traffic picking up to-go orders is always a good sign, too.

I honestly don't give out 5 stars too often, but this place is really good and I highly recommend it. The service is great, the food is exceptionally good, and it is always clean (unlike most mediterranean restaurants I seem to visit). 
I recommend the Chicken Shawarma Salad, healthy and tastes great.

Been back 3-4 times this year.  And discovered the gyros wrap.  Great!  This place if fine - only one thing keeps them from 5 stars in my book, and that's their Greek salad.  The dressing needs a real improvement. Try the restaurant at Happy Valley and 67th to see what I mean.  But back to Greek Wrap....the people are Great!  The gyros meat is delicious.  Lots of pride in the place and it shows.  Even when they're busy at lunch, they keep the tables and the floor clean.

This is one of our go-to Greek restaurants since moving here two years ago. The staff is friendly, and attentive. The food is cooked fresh and the flavor is great. Everything we have ordered has been delicious from gyros to chicken shawarma plates, sides and desserts.

Gyro Greek salad was quite large, tasty,  not a great taste to the tzatziki,  too much dill.

What I appreciated most about the place, which happens to be a hole in the wall in a strip mall, was the customer service.  Very friendly and cool peeps.

I would definitely stop back when I happen to be in Phx.
Love this place! It never disappoints. The chicken shawarma and the falafel pita are my favorites.

Best Chicken Greek Salad I've had, I like a place that has consistency in their staff, seems like its always the same folks there.... Hummus is bad to the bone, It would be nice if they had an option for veggies with the Hummus plate rather than pita, but pita is sooooo good..... JJ

My Valentine and I went here on the 14th of February mainly because we were at a loss of where to go, and we wanted something fast. Checking yelp, we decided on Greek Wraps because of its four star reviews, and I must say that I agree. 

Though the staff may look like a bunch of Jersey Shore rejects, they are without the attitude that makes one "from Jersey." 

The menu is pretty extensive for a walk-in Greek place. I got the Gyros Wrap and an order of baklava. My Valentine got the Falafel Wrap, and we split the hummus and pita appetizer. Everything was delicious. The meat in my Gyros was very tender and juicy (not dry like most of the places I've been). They also make all of the pita fresh as you order it. 

I will return for more of this delicious grub soon!
My favorite Greek restaurant.   I've enjoyed everything I've had here.  Clean, affordable,  and most importantly delicious!

This place never disappoints, the food is fun, flavorful, and always on point! The staff is fast friendly and courteous. I came in with my mom and my 9 month old son, they were helpful in asking us what we needed extra for my son. At the end of the meal I felt bad cause we made a mess. They told not to lift a finger and that they will take care of everything. I also had ordered a falafel wrap for my wife and they asked if they could make it at the end of our meal so it could be as fresh as possible. It was my Moms first time going and she said that she will be back for more. They are true example of how food should be made and how friendly customer service should be. I will always look forward to my next return.

I highly recommend this place if you are ever around the phoenix area.  I ordered the chicken Kabob plate and portions were pretty huge.  As part of the meal, I got a side of salad and a side of hummus mixed with Pita.  I didn't care too much for the salad but the Hummus is delicious.  The pita bread is warm so it's not like most places where they just took it out the fridge.  Also, this was the first place I went they used the high end soda machines (the ones at AMC theatres).

They have one of those Coca-Cola machines now for a wide selection of beverages. Service is friendly and timely bringing out your food. Still recommend the plates if you are really hungry. Two of their plates can feed my family of 3 no problem. I enjoy the rice more than the fries here too.

We love eating there - dine in or take out! My husband used to work quite close to there, so it was often also the lunch venue for us to meet for a quick bite together. It gets VERY busy there though for lunch time, so be warned!

Our kids love their food too!

Another huge advantage for us is -  they don't use garlic in the gyros or in their Tsatziki sauce (it is in some other items though, so please check with them!) 

My husband is allergic to garlic, which has pretty much made Greek food an impossibility  for him - until Greek Wraps! I could finally introduce him to some yummy Greek food!

Love their Gyros wraps!
Very friendly staff and great food. Never disappointed leaving this establishment. I really enjoy their food and also supporting a small family run business.

This place was incredible!!  Service was fantastic.  You can tell it was family owned and operated.  

I ordered the chicken and steak plate.  It was big enough for two people.  The meats was tasty and juicy.  Rice, hummus, pits, salad, etc all delicious.  

I'm already looking forward to my next trip to Phoenix.  This will be my first stop!!

King Gyro is still king of local Greek places in my book. A patient of mine recommended the location due to Armenian authenticity. Well, I thought the gyros was good and filling. The fries were ok but the tzatziki sauce is a little too dilly for me. Don't think I will be back unless somebody else is craving it.

Love love love this place! It's busy because it's awesome. Clean always. 
Their food is all made in house with exception to the pita bread, but the handmade bread is amazing!
Their kabob meat is always awesome among with their saffron rice and falafel.
Can't say enough great things about this place. If you like Greek - gotta come here!

Having lived in Greece and traveled extensively throughout the Middle East, I've had my share of authentic Gyros and Shawarmas.

That said, Greek Wraps definitely delivered authenticity in my experience.  I'd like to see the price a little lower than $7 for a 7'' Gyro if I were to give Greek Wraps 5-stars, but I'm content to give them 4 stars for a great-tasting Gyro which was loaded with meat.  The service and cleanliness of the order at-the-counter then sit style restaurant was solid.

Wow...just thinking about this place and writing a review is making me hungry. I went in here wanting to try something different and ended up getting something amazing! There are a lot of great menu options and I like that they give you a choice to have pita or wrap for your meals. 

The interior is actually really nice and it seems like they've got a lot of regular patrons. I can see why since this place is always clean and the staff is always friendly. I'm just glad that I've got another food option when it comes to lunch. I'm even thinking I might go again today :D
One of the best Greek restaurants I have ever eaten at! I come here a lot at lunch since they have an affordable lunch option that is quick and delicious.

I work about a mile down the road and it is our regular.  Many of my co workers are finicky eaters, but all agree it is consistently the best greek food.  They are always busy and efficient.  Of course large portions, and you can watch as they prepare the food so freshness is never an issure.

This place is really something. Have been here 4 times already and have tried something new each time and have never been disappointed. Their meats are so flavorful and complement their special sauce so well. Can't go wrong with the wraps but go for their platters over rice. Up there with the likes of Halal guys in NYC!
I love this restaurant! The food is fresh, well made and tasty...I'd give it a 5* if they weren't playing country music whenever I go in to eat!

This place is the amazing Greek Food !! Hands down period !!!!! Im an executive in Food Beverage Industry and  this place is clean, authentic, FRESH, courteous,
I cant recommend this any more --- but to say .. just go and try it !!!!! Amazing
The food here is fantastic!!!  The hummus is the best I've ever had!!  And the service- wonderful family owned business that obviously takes pride in what they do.

I think I may have found our favorite Greek restaurant in town. 

The chicken kabob schwarma was a medley of different flavors, and about as authentic tasting as it comes. Even the pita it comes wrapped in is made there and is noticeably better. The staff all seem very kind and there's a wide variety of items to choose from, right down to white or dark meat chicken. Fair prices and a military discount to boot. This place is now a regular stop when we're in the Arrowhead area. Hands down, the best schwarma I've had.

I and my hasband always miss Greek Wraps.Prof is clean,simple,rasonable price,good volumes, frash,really taste good and looks healthy.the  place is little small so if you want  eat with relaxed,Take-out is the best way.Most of times are busy.if you like farafel,try the farafel with special souce.

Best Greek place in the area by far. Quick and easy walk up and order. Service and fast and employees are very friendly. I enjoy the classic Gyro, rice and small side salad. Portions are large. Cheese does come on almost everything. Ask for an alternative sauce if you are lactose intolerant. I believe it is a garlic sauce- very tasty! This is a staple for us.
Delicious gyros, always made to order & wrap style (instead of pita) is the best! We eat here often and have always had excellent service.
Cannot get enough of this place, so fresh, flavorful, and good!!!! The hummus is good, the chicken kabob wrap is amazing and the pitas to die for.

The Best Gyros we've Ever had!  Consistently delicious
Definitely get a Gyro on their handmade Pita

This place is really really good. The only reason I'm docking a star is because I've come around lunch twice and both times they've messed up my order. Nonetheless this place is great for a chicken kabob pita wrap. Also, the lady (the owner I believe) dropping off orders around lunch is a little rude and in a rush. I asked her when she dropped off my wrap if it was a chicken kabob and she replied "whatever you ordered that's what it is" and my order was wrong.

my wife and I love the food and the service !
they make the best Mediterranean food !
we tell all of our friends and family members about the 
GREEK WRAP IS THE BEST !!!!!!!

I love this place. I'm very picky about the food I eat and especially picky about chicken. I decided to give this place a try and it was awesome. I tried the Greek chicken salad which has awesome flavor. This is the best Greek restaurant on this side of town.

Absolutely fantastic place.  We didn't know what to expect from a really simple-looking joint in a strip mall.  But it really was awesome all around.  The employees were super-friendly and helpful.  The food was just perfect, some of the best Greek we've had anywhere.  Portions are huge, and price is good.  The place was packed but service was still fast and very friendly.

Absolutely love their food! My parents would take us here often and when they did it was a great treat for us :) brings back good memories and gives you delicious food. My personal favorite spot to go to when it comes to Greek Wraps.

This place is great! The service was very friendly and everyone is working hard.

I love the chicken kabob with a small greek salad.  The salad is perfectly dressed.   The chicken is quality white meat breast seasoned great with awesome flame grilled flavor.  

They do a great job of keeping the place clean and visiting the tables to ensure your meal is correct.

I will definately be back.

Been 2 plus years since I've been here and this place is still doing great business and taking good care of the customers 

I got the gyros and it was stuffed with plenty of gyro meat, tzatsiki sauce tomatoes onions and lettuce.  In a warm and soft buttery pita bread. You don't get it any better.    My dad got  the gyro ceasar salad.  Again loaded with gyro meat  olives and pepprocini in it

Picked up an order of dolmades to go.  Fantastic!!!!

If you need a Greek fix, head to Greek wraps.  They will makes sure you get exactly what you need.

This is one of the better Greek/Mediterranean places in the West Valley. Maybe the best. It's always packed at any time of day, and the house baked pita bread wraps are incredible. They beat the dried out chewy pitas at some other pita places, hands down. This place is also definitely a culinary step up from the standard gyro places that also serve hot dogs and pizza. The ingredients are always fresh and the meats are never overly greasy. 

I always order the Chicken Shawarma plate with an extra pita. Upgrade for the home baked, you won't regret it. The rice, hummus and salad that come with the plate make it a fantastic value.

Side note: one star taken off because there is a slight bro-tastic vibe going on here, and it's occasionally weird. Maybe it's all the ads for gyms playing on the flat screen? I don't know, the customer service is always prompt and kind, so there are no complaints this way.

Best gyros in town!  Great service, very fresh and reasonably priced! The salads are huge and delicious, very fresh and crisp. Appears to be family owned and operated. If you like gyros then you will love this place.

I've heard a lot of good things about this place but never got around to trying their food until today. Food was amazing and everyone was really friendly! I will definitely be coming back and I'd recommend this place over Pita Jungle anyday! Thank you for the yummy food and awesome service!

I eat at Greek Wraps more than any other restaurant I think.  I really love it!! The only thing I have left to try is the pork... My fav is either the gyro plate or the chicken Shawarma pita. The way to go is to get the combo plate and an extra pita, split it between two people (cuz there is tons of food!), try a little of all the best (chicken Shawarma, gyro, steak).  It makes for a great dinner for under $20 for two :)... Who ever takes my order is always very nice. It is kept clean.  Great place!!
Food is good as always . Very sad that there Coke machine was out of diet . Server was good. The place was clean . Food grade by the city was A .
It's amazing!!!! I love this place, and they always have the best costumer service as well as amazing food ALL THE TIME!!!

I cannot explain all the stellar reviews. People must not have many good Mediterranean options around here. This place is mediocre at best. Beef shawarma was borderline inedible with tons of gristly connective tissue and artery/vein chunks. It was also dry, weird texture, and just gross. Poor quality meat. The steak and chicken kabob were passable/good but I've had much better. The Kefta which they call "ground beef" was fairly good. The rice is totally bland and not done correctly. Salad was dressing was bland. Hummus was good. The "garlic" sauce was literally ranch dressing and tasted like mayonnaise. It was not good at all I can't believe they dare call that garlic sauce. The homemade Pita bread was more like pizza dough. I asked to sub regular bread for the homemade with whatever upcharge and she said our food didn't come with Pita and to just add it. Well she shows up with 4 Pita breads (2 homemade and 2 regular) what a waste of bread since we just threw two away. If you're ever in Mesa try MVP Pita, they are excellent. I'm not from Phoenix but just happened to be in the Glendale area that day.

Fantastic shawarma. The bread is made while you wait. The sauce, delicious. Staying near here, I preferred it to go rather than eat in. 

Go Eco with your to-go take away containers.

This is my new favorite Greek place. I ordered the combo kabob plate with chicken and steak. It also comes with a salad, rice, hummus and pita! Everything was seasoned perfectly and the meats were tender and juicy. Even better than the food was the customer service. All the workers were very friendly and even brought my puppy who was waiting outside with my boyfriend a bowl of water. I will be back soon and often!

So far from my drop from Chicago to Arizona, this is by far the best place to eat at, assyrian operated. The meats are all juicy and marinated, and the prices are affordable. The employees are working hard and people are always familiar faces within the staff. The average meal is a dish, then an option of fries, salad or rice and lastly a drink. Overall, I would come here to eat again. I highly recommend this place!

I have never eaten anything here I do not like. The food is always fantastic. I usually get the chicken kabob wrap. Lately I have been getting the veggie wrap and both are amazing. I wish I could get one of everything. The meat and the bread on the wrap are always very fresh. Be prepared to wait around 20 minutes for your order. Worth the wait but you may want to call ahead to order.
Awesome gyros wrap! Good food, friendly employees. No alcohol, but a good selection of beverages!

I love Mediterranean food and this is the best I have had in Arizona. The salad and lamb were so fresh!  The dressing was amazing. The people working there were so nice and were so accommodating. I can't wait to return!

This is by far the best Greek/middle eastern food I've found in the valley. 

The shawarma comes in two sizes, and If you get the larger size (10 inch wrap), they use laffa/pita bread that they cook right behind the counter. 

I really like the steak shawarma wrap meal which comes with a drink and your choice of fries, salad or rice. I get rid of the garlic sauce that it comes with and ad tahini instead. Awesome!!!

Great Greek food. Awesome staff. 

I recommend the chicken shawarma wrap and also the falafel plate. So tasty.

Really awesome. Staff is great, food great, pita really great. (I sound like Tony the Tiger ... there're great!). 

Anyway, I'll find myself here more often because it's clean, yummy, and it appears that all the customers were enjoying the food.

The food is amazing!! The staff is super friendly. My only problem with this place is they have the soda machines that have every flavor combo, so it makes regular soda taste funny. But I asked if I could swap out my soda for a bottle of water, and they allow it. One of my favorite places in the city to eat
This place has excellent food. I love that they have one of those coke machines that has over 100 drinks to choose from. The Falafel, Gyros, & Greek Salad is excellent. We will definitely be back!

Love the gyro and the steak shwarma. The classic greek salad is yummy as well. They are super great with substitutions too! Hummus is way better than across the street at pita jungle. I would love if they delivered but the service is always so nice and friendly it makes up for it! If you're ordering fries ask for them extra crispy, or else they are a little too soft.
My favorite restaurant in Phoenix area !!  Food is always delicious and fresh!  Definitely recommend and will be back soon!

This place is alright. It's not bad, but it's not amazing either. I know this place has a close to 5 stars overall rating on yelp, but this is a 3 star place at best compared to other greek wrap places I've been to (in California!). I ordered a 10" Gyros wrap and a hummus appetizer (basically a plate of hummus dip with 4 pita bread slices). 

The 10" wrap was a huge portion, you definitely get your quantity here. The gyros was cooked well and crispy, but the wrap didn't have a good balance between the sauce (hummus) and vegetables. After a while you get tired of eating it because the taste gets monotonous and overpowering. It should be a medley in your mouth, but it's really not.

The hummus wasn't that amazing either. It's fresh, but in terms of flavor, it could be better.

Kudos on their hot fresh pita bread though, at least they nailed that down.

They were great!  They let me order a combo kabab salad  it was perfect. The chicken and beef were tender and spiced well. A few more olives would have been nice, but there was plenty of feta and dressing. The salad came with pita bread which was decent.
Love this place! The food is consistent every time I come here. Great customer service.

I ordered a gyro, it smelled like a gyro, but when I got home I realized they forgot the gyro :( 

Instead I got a side of gyro meat & rice. I at e a little bit & the meat wasn't bad, but alas, I needed something more!

Used to have take outs from here. Today we stopped for lunch and had chicken kabob salad and ground beef kabob salad. Both were super delicious even without dressing. Portions were too big and had a full box left over to take home. Will be dining in more.

If you're looking for fresh Mediterranean this is the place to go! The food was so fresh and you can see them cooking the food! Everything came out tasting great. I ordered the steak kabob plate. It comes with rice, salad, pita, & humus. Who doesn't love humus?! It had great flavor. The staff is friendly. My meal was $15.00 so not extra cheap, but comparable to most Greek restaurants I've been too. The only complaint was the steak was a little tough with fatty pieces, but this isn't a steakhouse so i wouldn't expect filet mignon lol. Will definitely be back!
this place has amazing wraps, by far the best greek salad I have had in a long time. MUST HAVE!!!

I went here tonight with super high hopes.  Unfortunately, my hopes were trashed.  I'm one of those people that requires efficient and half friendly service.  That is totally not what I got here.  The young kids (I know, I'm probably too young to be calling anyone that) were irritated by the presence of pretty much every customer in the place.  It also didn't help that the young girl at the register was fawning over one of the chefs, to the point that I witnessed inappropriate touching.  A child walked up at one point, and politely asked for a glass for water, the counter chick gave her the death look for absolutely no reason.  They were just rude, and bad service really turns me off.

I ordered the chicken kabob plate which came with a salad, hummus, pita, rice and the actual kabobs.  The kabobs were nothing spectacular and the meat quality turned me off.  Everything was pretty mediocre, except the hummus which I thought was a bit better than average.  

Will I try this place again?  Maybe- I'd likely give it one more chance (because locally owned places are hard to find in this area of town), in hopes that the service would be less ridiculous AND perhaps go the route of the gyro that many other reviewers have mentioned.

Very fresh and delicious. Could eat their chicken kebab pita sandwich all the time. The seasoning is top-notch and the chicken is very flavorful and juicy. And the pita itself is so fresh and fluffy. Fantastic place!

Uhhh best chicken shawarma I have EVER had!! We drive way out of our way to go to this place. It is always packed when we go there but it is definitely worth the wait. They make their items fresh to order which is a HUGE plus for me.

This was the best lunch I have had in Peoria since I started working here six months ago. The chicken kebab pita was delicious. Very fresh pita, flavorful chicken and good service. The restaurant was mobbed at lunch, but the food came quickly and the manager even managed to ask how my meal was. It is clearly a well run and popular establishment.
Love this place. They have the best food.  Always so friendly and always so courtesy towards their customers.  I recommend the combo kabob.  So yummy.

Its really upsetting bc their food is so bomb and delicious, but the guy that works there is so extremely rude.  Wish they could work on their customer service because im a regular customer and would expect better attitude.
So far the best Greek we've eaten in and around Phoenix.  Falafels are great and the homemade bread is ridiculous!!
Awesome. This place is one of my Favorites. They have a Chicken Shwarma Wrap that is Killer. This place is very clean and the staff is always friendly.

Best CHICKEN SHAWARMA IN ARIZONA!
Family run business and very very friendly. This place is always packed as the food is simply amazing.  The steak plate is also amazing and only $10.  You get a huge portion as well. I go here a couple times a month.  If you love gyros, shawarma and falafel you MUST GO HERE!

Great food, good selection, good price.  The hummus is excellent!  We love the gyro sandwich and wrap, and the Greek salad with or without gyro meat.  The shawarma is very flavorful.  Convenient location and very friendly service make this place a winner for us.
Good Greek food. The Gyros and Steak Shawarmas are pretty good.  Friendly service. Very dimly lit restroom.

Glendale is pretty limited with non-chain restaurants so finding this place was amazing!

All of the kabob plates, the gyro plate, and chicken and steak shwarma plates are delicious! 

They seem to be relatively busy all the time, so it's great to call in for pick-up on busy nights like Friday! 

Easily became one of my favorite Glendale restaurants. If you haven't tried it, TRY IT! Friendly staff, too!

Amazing food, friendly, quick service. This place is usually packed so you know it's good but the line moves fast. I could eat here every single day. The food is fresh and extremely flavorful. I had a bad experience with the falafel at Pita Jungle and so I decided to try them here and WOW, they are to die for. I'm so happy I live so close. It is worth your trip!

So I have been craving Falafel...haven't had good falafel in at least a year.  MMM - that cucmber yogurt with romaine in a delish pita.  

I saw this place and saw they had falafel, so was stoked.  Order a large meal.  Well, not sure how they truly do it in Greece, but this place put's some lettuce, tomatoes, falafel, and ranch.  Very americanized if you ask me.  

Won't be back.  The search will continue for good falafel.

I have never been disappointed at this place, and everyone I have ever brought here has loved it!  My picky eater begs me to take him here for the chicken kabab... I love the original chicken kabab wrap and the salads...

So usually I'm a chicken shawarma or greek salad kinda gal but my aunt recommended that I try the steak shawarma WRAP (not the pita) and OMG it's amaze-balls!!  It's probably not the healthiest thing one could select from the menu (which by the way, there are plenty of healthier options there) but seriously, you have to try it at least once if you're a meat eater.  It's so tasty and the wrap goes perfectly with it!

Not very impressed by this place.  The ground beef kabob is the only good thing i've had there.  There rice is bland and not a good texture, seems like instant rice or something.  their humus is kind of bland.  the chicken i had was rubbery.  The bread and garlic butter stuff is good and fries are good but overall disappointing.  Their meat except the lamb is halal so i've gone there a few times and will probably at some point be back only because a lack of options.

Outstanding.  You know how you try something then you have to try it again, it was that good?  This is that place.  Gyros are delicious. Nice Pita bread.  The Chicken Schwarma done with the thigh meat is "the best in the valley".  Good people. Clean restaurant with excellent service.  Our go-to place when shopping on Bell Road.
The BEST Mediterranean food i've had in the west valley. I'm a huge critic when it comes to food like this, but this place blew my mind.

Man my first time here was a blast! The counter girl was cute and funny. She gave my order number and it was 65. I asked if I could have 69 and she said no they skip that number . She was clearly joking. But when that number came up and she was about to call for it she gave me a heads up. Both my girl and giggled like children. More importantly than the service being nice and funny, the food was so delicious. And they give you such enormous portions you can't finish. For what I paid and what I got. Man it was a steal! Place is nice and clean too! They were tidy and organized. Plus they kept asking if we were good which I always appreciate! Come here fo sho! Get anything on the menu especially the chicken!

I have been here numerous times in the past without any issue. I went with a group of coworkers during our lunch hour. We ordered our food and 3 of 5 of us received our food promptly while the last 2 waited 30 minutes for our wraps to arrive. When I asked the server if our food was almost ready, she rudely cut me off and did not allow me to finish my question. Her response was defensive and not even a valid reason why we were still waiting. The food was yummy but we had to eat it in 5 minutes so we could get back to work. Customer service was terrible.

This place is really great. Everyone I have taken here loves it. It is always crowded, so you know it is good.

My mom and I really like the falafel. I havent had a falafel that good anywhere else. It is perfectly fried and has a lot of flavor in it. Sometimes I get it in a pita, or on top of a greek salad. It is really good.

I also love the hummus and pita bread appetizer. Another good app is the taziki and pita.  The baby loves to eat all of those.

My husband always gets the schwarma (sp?) wrap and says it is great. You can get it with a meal deal that includes salad or fries and a drink. The fries are fresh cooked and delicious. His only complaint is he can't get it spicy enough.

Even my in laws who do not like most foods like this place, so you know its good!

This is one of my favorite greek place in town. They have such a big variety but I always get the chicken kebob wrap with a side salad. Excellent food and good service all in one. Will definitely be back real soon.

First of all, let me say how busy it was- but so worth the short wait. We ordered the flaming feta as a starter and it was DELICIOUS to say the least. The bread was fresh and hot, and slightly crispy which was perfect for our liking. For an entree we ordered the Chicken Shawarma Plate and Chicken Shawarma Salad. The salad was really good, and the chicken was really yum. The plate- eh. The rice had no flavor or taste, and the chicken they use was obviously chicken thigh, it's was tender and cooked great but was no my favorite. I ended up eating half of my boyfriend salad and only the hummus off of my plate. 

Overall, I loved the salad and appetizer. I also want to mention that there were 2 young guys working there, and they were incredibly nice and came to Cheka on us twice and had really superb customer service. For those reason, I will be going back for feta dip and salad!

This is one of my all time favorite places to eat.  The staff is friendly and the food is fantastic.  You can't go wrong with any choice on the menu but my favorites are the chicken Greek salad or the chicken kabob plate. 
 The salads are always fresh, the chicken is always flavorful, the rice is delectable.  The portion sizes is generous.  Great value for money.  
Seating is occasionally a problem when it is busy.   There aren't many tables.  They appear to be very clean.

I had never had Greek food that I liked.... Until I went to Greek Wraps. Now,  I'm obsessed! Their portions are so big that my husband and I always split the #gyromeatplatter and leave stuffed! Ask for extra white sauce you won't regret it.

By far the best Greek place for gyro wraps in AZ. Although the wait time is long, the food always comes out fresh because they don't make your food until you order it, which I prefer. I recommend getting the larger gyro  rather than the smaller size because they use better homemade bread on the larger gyros. My go to dish is the half steak half chicken plate, which comes with pita, and a tasty Greek salad. Also their garlic tzatziki sauce is amazing!

There are so few restaurants that aren't chains in Peoria it's nice to find an original like this place. Their food is fresh, authentic and delicious. The chicken kebab was fabulous and so are there gyros... The only thing they could do better really is to enhance their Greek salad dressing. It's not tangy enough for me... Other than that this place is a winner.

I've been here three times now and love every moment of it. It's always been crowded but once you experience the food, you'll see exactly why. I also liked that they had vegetarian meal choices as well as a soda machine that gives you a plethora of flavors to choose from. The staff is always patient and welcoming and it's nice to get a glimpse of the kitchen from the counter and know that your food is not being tampered with and cooked properly. They also have a kids menu with a mix of American and Greek options to choose from. I look forward to trying thier desserts next
Ordered a steak kabob wrap & spinakopita and they were both Amazing!  My friend enjoyed his gyro wrap & falafel.  Great service, excellent food.  Will be back...
Great falafel! Hummus was absolutely delicious, service was great very clean place . We will be back to try more.

I've never received anything less than perfect service and a perfect meal. The appetizer combo is a phenomenal deal especially if you don't eat meat. Falafel, dolmas, hummus, babaganoush, tabbouleh, greek salad, pita bread and tsatsiki sauce. I'm full for days but I always want more!
Delicious gyros and overall friendly staff. Reminds me of some of the mom and pop places back home in MI. Highly recommend!

I've lived here 28 years & was convinced gyros in AZ were the worst. I had given up trying to find a good one. I can't say how many times I passed by this place, being tempted to try just one more, but would keep going, not believing I'd ever find anything here like back in NYC.  Today I gave this place a shot & OMG!!!  It was SO GOOD!  So glad I finally stopped & never gave up the search!  I can't wait to go back & try the shawarma & everything else!  Very nice atmosphere for a takeout place, if you choose to dine in...very welcoming, attentive & friendly staff....I love this place!

WoW is how I will start this.  I stopped in here due to seeing other good reviews and man were they right. The Food was great, and I tried all my friends food too. I had the Chicken kabob and it was delicious. Clean place. Staff was welcoming and the bathroom was clean ( not always easy to find). Try this place if you feel like Greek food, you not be disappointed!!

Update: came back during the busiest time to see if things changed. They didn't. Staff handled the crowds well even laughing and smiling, great ambiance they create.  My new favorite lunch stop.

Omg this Greek food was amazing. 

My sister took me hear for lunch when I was visiting. I ordered a chicken pita sandwich (can't remember the name ) it was spectacular. So filling and every single bite was delicious. I even went back to the same place and ordered the same meal, the very next day! Customer service was good, a lot of smiles and genuine concern for the customers . 

A gem in Glendale. Give it a try!
One of the BEST places I have ever been to. Clean environment fresh food. The combo platter and the STEAK shawarma plate/ WRAP is amazing. Tasty food and great staff
Best F-N  food at Arrowhead and then go and give it a try if you don't like it I will pay for it I will tell Angie we look great service

The best Greek food I have had since being back stateside! I lived in Germany 15 years and besides Greece no better place to get these! Wow they brought me back to the good old days! Thanks for wonderful locale. try everything nothing bad to choose from!
First time here and it was amazing! Tried the steak kabob wrap and it was cooked perfectly. Enjoyed the garlic sauce that came on it. Can't wait to try the rest of the items.

Greek wraps is one of the tastiest places I have ever been to. Their gyro is superb, and their falafel is one of the best. If you go, definitely get the "Wrap" vs the Pita. The wrap is freshly made, and it really adds to the meal.

The rice is incredible, the dolmas are ok, they might be pre-packaged, but my Fiance and I have been going there since they opened, and we've loved it. The owners are very nice, and yeah, sometimes it does take a little bit of time to get the food, but really, should you be in a rush to wolf food down your throat? If you want that, theres a Burger Slop down the road.
Outstanding. I don't give out five stars often but they deserved one. Fresh, delicious and friendly. If anything the only complaint was plastic forks.

One of my favorite restaurants ever! I love this place. I've been coming here for years and don't see that changing anytime soon. This is another one of those places where everyone seems to be a regular. The food is just phenomenal. Everything they serve is made on site with the exception of the small pita breads. The best falafel I've ever had. My standard order is typically the combo kebab plate with chicken and steak. Out of this world. Even their "basic" gyro wraps are ridiculously good. The quality to price ratio is outstanding. The staff has always been top notch. I recognize the chef's faces for years now which should tell you something. You won't be disappointed.
Amazing food so happy I found this place. Its so fresh you can go wrong with anything you order
I'm back!!! Love this place it's so damn good and healthy. Smiling faces and quick service!!

This is really one of the best wraps places I've been to in Az. If you have had Greek food in Chicago or New York, this is as close as it gets in the North valley. The hummus is the best I have ever had and they give you a nice portion when you get the chicken kabob plate. My husband likes the Greek salad, which is loaded with gyro meat. It's a little pricey and sometimes you have to wait a bit for your order, but they give you more than enough to justify the cost and the food is fantastic! this place is one of my favorite!

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! Every this is consistenty good and prices are reasonable with large portions. Same people have been working the register a long time. I have used their catering several times as well and they never fail to please. The only recommedation I would make is that if you're using them for take out, check your bag first to make sure you have everything you should. Somethign has been missing on more than one occasion.

I don't normally venture to the west side, but I was attending a conference in Peoria and my coworker and I were craving Greek food for lunch.

It had hits and misses.

We shared the hummus to start. The hummus was tasty but it had a bit of a weird grainy texture. And it could have used more lemon. The pita it came with was yummy and perfectly toasted.

I had the falafel pita meal. The falafel pita was very mediocre. The falafels weren't zesty or crispy on the outside. The french fries that accompanied them were dull. 

My friend had the chicken schwarma salad. She liked the chicken itself but said the salad was drippy and watery.

Service was fast, friendly, and efficient. No complaints there. 

If I lived closer I would probably give Greek Wraps another try. However, I live 20 minutes away and Chicago Gyros and Sabas more than satisfies my Greek craving in my own vicinity.

The best greek food I have every had! This place is always busy because their food is so good. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu. I recommend trying something with their chicken kabob. Its the best greek grilled chicken i've ever tasted. The prices are great and the portions are big.

AMAZING food. This place is always busy and rightly so, they have quality food. If you are in the area try it out, I promise you will be back. The place is small and sometimes it can take a while to get your food but it tastes so good its always worth it.

This stop seemed like a "no-brainer" loved by Yelpers and busy. However, the chicken in my salad was terrible. I ordered the Chicken Greek Salad. The seasoning was tasty but the chicken was so rubbery, that it had a weird crunch when I chewed, an experience I have never had. The staff couldn't be more attentive here. They delivered the food to my table after ordering at the counter. They checked on me several times. I did not want any other food from them, so did not discuss the quality of my food. The Chicken Greek Salad was $10.49.
We live eating the gyros here! The fries have no salt so skip them and get salad instead! I always go back for more! My daughter also loves the kid menu!

How have I not written a review about this place yet? 

I come here probably twice a month, easily the best greek I've ever had. EVERYTHING I've had here is just awesome. The gyro, chicken, rice, steak, pitas... everything is just top notch. Just such a strange location for such a great restaurant.

Love this place. The staff is great, and the food is the best in the valley. The food is home made from family receipts. The portions are large and at a good price. They are very clean, and have received an A rating on a number of occasions. They take pride in their place, and the food. They will make what you want to how you like it. As a foodie this is my go to spot. Give them a shot, and enjoy their food.

I love coming to this place, the cashier/server Angela is super cool, completely friendly, and all around a positive person. I have never brought a friend here that didn't just love their food. It's fresh, it taste amazing, and honestly I have never felt bloated after eating. You eat good, then you feel good. It's simple, if you wanna feel good, then you gotta eat Greek Wraps!
Excellent food as usual.  However, 30min wait to get my food on a Friday night while others that came after me with large orders got theirs first!

This place is fantastic! Doesn't look like much from the outside, but it was busy inside. The young man at the counter was very nice and everyone was friendly. We ordered the gyro sandwich and the gyro fries. Both were delicious! Perfectly seasoned meat, the bread was soft and fresh and the sauce was to die for! First time here, and I know we will be back soon!

Get their homemade bread! I am not a big fan of wraps since all it usually is is a flour tortilla or something similar. But here, they do wraps with pita bread or their fresh baked bread. Definitely go for the later. It is more expensive than the pita bread but I think it's worth it - it's bigger so that's why.
I got the chicken shawarma sandwich/wrap. The bread was warm and yummy. They loaded it with TONS of chicken. Almost to the point where it was a bit too much but that only makes it a great deal for your money. It was $7.49. 
The only slight I had was that I always like dark meat over white meat. The description said it was made from chicken thighs.  When I got it, it was more like half and half.  That or half the dark meat was dry.  But that's minor since in most cases, that would be the better deal since white meat is usually more.  
Friendly staff too.

I had to come back here when My Big Fat Greek at Arrowhead Mall screwed up my order...I'm 9 months pregnant so when I want a Gyro Wrap, I WANT a Gyro Wrap! I got back to work to discover My Big Fat Greek had given me a CHICKEN wrap! Wasn't happy! I knew I had to go to a place where I know it wouldn't be screwed up. And they haven't disappointed me yet!
Word of advice- if you're gonna go somewhere for good Greek food, make sure you see the lamb on the spit...otherwise you're wasting your time.
My absolute favorite place for lunch, very reasonably priced, clean and has great service!!! Try it if you have not been!

Nice clean place, pleasant staff. Had falafel as appetizer and the chicken kabob wrap, both delicious and served with a very tasty sauce. Total was less than $20 for 2 people. Will definitely be coming back!

This is a wonderful little place to eat and though we were pretty hungry from a long day, it was great that we found this place and that my husband was opened to trying it.  There were a host of chain restaurants all around, but we wanted something different and a fresh, clean, homemade taste of food and this was the perfect place.

The place was packed, the food was absolutely delish!  We love some of the Greek places in the east valley, but the flavor of the food of Greek Wraps was awesome and very good.  

The service was excellent and each person was attentive and friendly to us as well as all their other customers.  Excellent customer service.

We ordered a plate of Steak Kabobs, which had that with a yellowish type rice, a sauce, pita, a salad, and another dressing that has garlic and I think some cumin in it.  One of the guys there said it's sort of like ranch, but I didn't think it had any semblance to ranch.  My husband, kids and I loved it and fought for the sauce.

My daughter and I ordered Gyro Wraps and there is plenty of meat in the wraps, so you'll definitely get your protein worth and a very good price at under $7 for this huge thing.  Our son ordered a Falafael Pita and he really liked it, too and that was really filling for him.

We made the mistake of ordering a side of french fries and onion rings, which really was way, way too much food for our family of four and we left there with leftovers and completely stuffed, but very satisfied.

The meats were very flavorful and not bland.  And everything tasted like it was homemade and fresh, not the chain restaurant type taste.  

We would love to come more frequently, but it's more than 50 miles from where we live, but if we happen to be coming home from Flagstaff, Prescott, Sedona or needing to do something in the NW valley, we'll stop by and grab some food to go.

Totally worth every penny and the wait for the food.  If I could give you more stars, I would.  

Thank you!!!!

Best Mediterranean fast food I have ever had. The pita bread is fresh and delicious, hummus is creamy and well-seasoned, the garlic sauce and tsatziki are phenomenal. The chicken kabobs are excellent and the gyro meat is even better. They also have a kid's menu with stuff to satisfy picky eaters (like corn dogs and French fries). The food is prepared fresh, comes out quickly, and the staff are very nice and helpful. All-around fantastic experience and will definitely be going back!

I Love this place, the only issue is I ate it so much that I couldn't get it for a while, finally went back today and yep - I'll probably over do it again!
You just can't go wrong with this food "a y of it"

As always the food was great!
I was asked to sample two new hummus's 
The first was the roasted red pepper cilantro.... It was amazing!!
The second was a jalapeño... Equally as good!!
They already have the best hummus in the valley, and they may add two more.

Been to Greek Wraps several times. Recently came here and it was so good that I came back the next day! Very good Greek food, in my opinion one of the best in town. The workers are always friendly and they have a great selection. 

I had their Gyro on their house made wrap. It was super good, but the tip here is to make sure to if you order the wrap to eat it warm at the restaurant. I've been told that the wrap may get a little soggy if you wait too long to eat.  But eating it fresh there at the restaurant was one of the best gyros I've ever had. 

I've also had their steak kebab plate with rice and hummus. It also comes with a Greek salad as well. Very tasty and good. 

Overall a great local west valley gem. I'll be back soon enough!

I didn't set out to go eat at this place but I'm sure glad I ended up there. I walked in on a Saturday and the place was busy. That's a good thing right? They were very clean and seemed well organized. I waited a little longer than I would have liked but it WAS a Saturday.. They made the best chicken salad I've ever eaten.. Well worth the wait. I've tried quite a few Greek restaurants but this place is by far the best I've eaten at. The chicken I had was marinated perfectly and cooked just right, super moist!! It's right down the street from where I work so I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. You've got to try this place!!

This place is great. 

I have been 3-4 times, ACCIDENTALLY. 

I obviously check Yelp for places to eat, and somehow I am always in Peoria/Glendale when I am in the mood for Greek/Mediterranean food. So I look for 4 star+ places and repeatedly end up here. 

The service is quick, the staff are sweet, the food is consistent, and the portions are perfect. 

I will definitely be back again.

Greeks wraps is a great place for lunch in the Arrowhead Mall area.  I always get the steak shawarma on a 7" pita, the garlic sauce is great.  It gets very busy right at noon so you may have to get it to go.  Only about 10 table or so inside this place but the food is fantastic.  I have not had anything else here but my wife usually gets a gyro or a salad and she is always pleased as well.
Awesome gyros with great prices too. Been here several times and it never disappoints. The pita is light and fluffy and the meat is tender and moist.

Consistently good food! We enjoyed the gyro plate. Gyro meat, Greek salad, pita bread, hummus and safron rice. The portion is large. We split a gyro plate for dinner and get extra tyzeki sauce.  We have also enjoyed the fish plate and ground beef plate.  Friendly staff and excellent service
Great food, friendly people working, the chicken shawarma was full of flavor, juicy and the humus went well with the dressing.  I'd order it again.

I love this place!  The best Greek food I have found in the Valley.  Everything I have had on their menu has been outstanding. But if I had to pick a favorite, it would be the gyro plate just because the food proportion is the best and you get a mix of the meat, rice, sauce and hummus.  I usually get an order of the eggplant dip to go with it as well.
We come here all the time as a family. My husband and I always share the combo kabob plate because it is so much food! Hands down best Greek food in town!!!

We had lunch here for the first time, and I assure you, it won't be our last. The menu is incredible. We had the Feta Gyro Pita. Perfectly prepared and delicious. Included in the menu were Italian beef sandwiches, Chicago dogs, and Greek dogs. I must check them out. The staff appeared to be family,  who were very nice. The service was outstanding. The establishment was very clean and organized nicely.
Gyro was real good!!  I'll be back for more. The fries were soggy-ish. Not good. The salads were great. I thought the gyro needed a bit more sauce though.

Hands down the best in the west valley! Highly recommend the steak shawarma plate, Gyro plate, ground been kabob plate and falafel Greek salad! Servings are huge, the service is always fantastic but the seating is usually hard to get. (This is a busy place) If you don't take it to go, which we often do, you can usually secure a spot somewhere outside and the staff has been really awesome in bringing it out to us as we usually end up in the outdoor seating by Panda.
Amazing food. Very clean. Great chefs prepare food to perfection. Tastes like a 5 star restaurant.

My friend said he knew a great middle eastern restaurant and he was right! I had the gyro and by the advice of the guy behind he counter I had the large bc it was with the pita bread they make there and it was amazing!!!! I also bought a baklava and loved it too. The guy and girl behind the counter that found out it was my first tie were so rad about making sure I knew how happy they were that my friend brought me. They even threw in some extra of their homemade yogurt sauce which was the best I have ever had, even better than my own! I shared some hummus and the Greek salad with my friend as well and was really impressed with it all.

If you like greek food this will certainly satisfy your craving.  It's all about the food here, atmosphere is lacking.  Price is reasonable.  This is not a chain.  Only criticism is the wait, not fast service, but I guess you have to wait for the good stuff.  Give this place a try when you want Greek, then go next door to Juju Berry for dessert.

This place is super yummy and affordable. The gyro meat is super good and fresh, the tzatziki and pita appetizer was good and the wife's salad not only looked wonderful but tasted just as good. Definitely a go to Greek place in the West Valley.

We found it! The best Greek food in the West Valley. After moving here from the East we haven't had any luck until now. Great portions at a great price. The whole family left with happy full stomachs.

I really like this place, not only is the food fresh and tasty but the service is always very nice. I usually take it to go but sometimes we sit in. I love pretty much anything I have tried tho I stick to the faves or most common plates such as gyros, falafel etc. I tell others when I like a place so I have told a few and brought friends also.  Will continue to come back and try out new dishes.
This is by far the best gyros and shawarma plates by far. Everything is delicious here.  Even their water tastes better lol. Make sure you order the sandwiches with their homemade wraps, very tasty.
Quick, fabulous food.  Helpful, friendly staff!  Very busy lunch rush on weekdays. Worth the wait!

I visited this place tonight for the first time with my hubby and we loved it! Not only does it smell amazing the second you walk in, but the staff were incredibly nice and welcoming. She went out of her way to get us things we didn't even ask for. The meat is carved off right in front of you as well as put together right there so you could watch if you wanted. It is very relaxed and homey. I got the gyro salad and it was so amazing. We also got the falafel plate to share and those were the BEST falafel I've ever had. Make sure to ask for the hot sauce if you like heat. It's awesome! We will be back many more times.

This place has fantastic food just wish it wasn't also so busy. You can never get a table and even take out there is always a wait. They should do more with the restaurant maybe upgrade and get a bigger location.

Tried this place for the first time last night after seeing the good reviews. It's great! 

I had the chicken shawarma wrap and it was super good. Fresh, yummy and huge! I probably shouldn't have eaten the whole thing, but it was so good I took it down and figured I'd just pay for it later.

The restaurant is clean. The staff were quick and friendly. I'll definitely be returning.

I absolutely love this place! I've been coming here for a couple of years now, and I can easily say I've never had a bad experience. The staff is so friendly and the food is so delicious. They have a good menu, their pitas are amazing but I also absolutely love the Chicken Greek Salad. Highly recommended!
I can eat here everyday. And I almost do amazing food and quality is always constantly amazing.

YES! Grab your nom nom face and head on over! 
Experience: I looked this place up on yelp since I knew I'd be in the area. My wife and I went in and the place was packed, no tables. We were ordering and one opened up, my wife quickly snagged it and after I sat down the guy came over and wiped it down for us. 
Food: Food took a little bit to be done but they were crazy busy, in store and phone orders. The food was amazing! I got steak shawarma and my wife got a fish wrap and baklava. I cannot wait to go back, I neeeed it.
For the record, I'd had gyros/wraps before.. first time with shawarma. I asked the guy taking orders what he recommended and went along with it. I want to explore the whole menu.

Update: I've been back so many times I cannot count anymore.. it is just great freakin' shawarma.

I love this place! Its my favorite place to eat! Their Chicken Kabob plates are sooooo good! I highly recommend it! You can't go wrong here with anything you order. Always alot of food on your plate and its fresh too! Employees are really friendly its like being with family and having a meal together.

This is 1 of our favorite spots in the valley. We order the combo kabob plate and share it! It's so much food and aLwAyS bomb. Plus, the service is incredible! We definitely recommend Greek Wraps any day of the week
