This place is always busy for a reason. It's honestly the best place to go if you're craving a Mediterranean meal in the Arrowhead area. Food is amazing. Employees are super polite and friendly. The place is clean. You'll never see a dirty table, because they're always quick to rush and wipe a table down when a customer leaves. Definitely try this place out of you haven't already.

Great food! I have been a customer for a good 7/8 years now. I always order my favorite item on the menu- chicken shwarama! It's delicious...as all of their menu is. 

Definitely a place that will satisfy your cravings for tasteful food!

Yelp rarely lets me down. And I found a wonderful place right near my apartment. This is Greek at its best!

The place itself is nothing to write home about. Slightly crowded, dim, and not much seating. But it's CLEAN! That's all I really care about. The staff makes it feel like home too. Engaging others and myself in conversation while attending to tables. Really impressive staff.

Obviously if it is nothing special by looks, then it seriously delivers on substance. The hummus was good. Tasty and a decent portion. The baba ganoush is SO good. Definitely recommend at least getting the 50 cent cup of it to try it out! And the pita chicken kabob was great! Plenty of food portion wise and didn't feel overpriced at all.

Overall great place. A great alternative to chain restaurants. Excited to try other dishes here in the future!

The beauty of Chicago is the huge selection of ethnic foods we get to sample.  So I was disappointed with the Greek selection Glendale has to offer

Falafel had a weird grimy taste to it.  Texture wasn't all there.  Gyros were dry.  Yogurt sauce accompanying it, bland

They tried, they failed...MISERABLY

I ordered a regular pita gyro. That's the first thing I had to try. I was not surprised by how delicious this gyro was! Size portion was generous and not skimpy like other places. Every ingredient was fresh and the meat was juicy!

What a great little family run Greek restaurant this is for the Arrowhead area.  I have been here several times and each time have enjoyed every bite of what I ate.  Sometimes in the suburbs it's tough to find good ethnic food.  This fills the void for the area.
It's not a fast food joint, but it doesn't take to long for your food to be prepared.  Decor is clean and not so bad.  The Greek music(I think that's what being played) adds a soothing feeling.  Prices are reasonable and service is ok.
I enjoy every time I come here and definitely feel like I'm getting a good value for what I pay for.

Just finished lunch and wow it was delicious! I got the chicken kabob plate, you can't go wrong what that. The pita was fresh and hot and the hummus, unlike any I've ever tasted, was amazing. It was enough to feed my mom and I...with a little left over! I will definitely be back.
I LOVE this place! The food is hot and delicious and the staff are always friendly.  Can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Even my picky kids like to eat here
Love this place only Greek restaurant that makes fresh pitta's.

I'm updating my review to 4 out of 5 instead of 5 out of 5.

First off, HERE'S A TIP: Call them ~20 minutes ahead of time to call in your order... or else you will be waiting there for your food for a long while.

The food itself is 5 out of 5. Again, the gyro plate is phenomenal. It comes with generous amount of rice, hummus, gyro, side salad, pita bread, and tzatziki sauce. The steak kabob is also delicious. Every time I come here, I have to get both the gyro plate and the steak kabob because I cannot go without one or the other. 

I docked off one star because of the service. The people who work there could be a little more happy and smile more....
My mom & I had lunch here.  2 small Greek salads, salad was fresh and crispy, could use a little more dressing or some on the side for a little more flavor but overall was up to par..

This place is delicious!  A friend recently introduced me to Greek Wraps and I have been there twice since!  The chicken shawarma is delicious.  The spice on the chicken is unique and a delicious unexpected addition.  I definitely recommend the wrap over the pita. If you have a hankering for Greek food this is the place to go!

I've been going to this place for a couple of years The food is always great and fresh.
That's one thing I'm looking in food consistency.
The service is always good and the food is quick to arrive.
I would definitely recommend this place

My husband had the gyro and fries and he liked it but he thought it could be bigger. I had the chicken steak shawarma plate with rice and hummus. Wish there was less rice and more hummus but it was very good and a lot of food. I left half on the plate but if you are a big eater you will love it. Service was awesome. Place is real small so you might have to wait for a seat or take it to go. Coke products which is great!
This has been a family fave for over a decade. The food is excellent, huge servings and great prices.

Best gyros I've had. Flavorful and not too greasy. If you get the combo plate, you have a choice of fries, rice, or salad, which is nice. Reasonable prices, good, fresh food, very friendly staff. It gets very busy, and  sometimes the wait can get a little long for your food, so if you're in a hurry, maybe the middle of the lunch hour isn't the best time to go.

This place is amazing ! I ordered the chicken kabob platter and i was not disappointed. Delicious chicken a lot of food and the tzatziki sauce and garlic sauce are SO GOOD !! The staff here is so friendly and helpful. It was my first time and they were happy to answer questions about the menu. It can take about 15 minutes to get the food when they're busy but it's worth it since all the food is fresh. If you get a salad with your meal they do bring that out before the main plate which can help with the wait for your meal. 
Definitely will be back ! Highly recommend !!
As always great food, fresh, and incredibly  tasty! This beats pita jungle any day! The place is always clean, the people are friendly and always welcoming!

I remember when they opened this place. It hid some really good food, behind a small strip mall facade. They have become popular enough to remodel and it's really nice inside. 
My wife and I started doing low carb and we come for steak kabob salads, chicken shawarma salads and a side of gyro meat. The garlic sauce is delicious. 

TL:DR food is great service is always outstanding

We eat here quite frequently and the food NEVER disappoints. We came here on a very busy Friday and unfortunately, there was a delay getting our food (rice was still cooking) so we waited over 40 minutes for food, which with a toddler equates to 3 hours lol. When we brought it to their attention, they were very apologetic and accommodating. They did everything in their power to take care of us. We really appreciated the customer service. Still our favorite gyro spot. It's a must try for everyone!
We love this place. Excellent falafel and shawarma and gyros. Fast service. Friendly service. Nice! We recommend it.

It used to be a good place to eat but today the waitress is rude, I can't see her name and I don't want to make a conversation with her, she is not smiling at all and she is giving us orders when she is putting the plates on the table, we are 7 people (family) having lunch here

This was my first time in and the employees were all so nice! They gave great recommendations and were attentive the whole time. It was also VERY clean and fast. The combo meal comes with a big portion of rice and the pita is bigger then what I expected. I will be returning again when I have more than a 30 minute lunch break!

I took my wife here. We loved it..nothing fancy but a great lunch spot considering it is in a strip center and Peoria/Glendale is not know for food like Central Phoenix and Scottsdale..The bread is fresh.The meat was great. Tzatziki sauce was perfect. I am definitely going back... Even if I have to drive an hour...The only thing I didn't like was the fries... The owner should have had Greek fries on the menu(SKINNY CRISPY WITH FETA)....

The food is good. Portion size is BIG! Wait-time during lunch hours is kind of long. Restaurant is clean and staff is friendly enough. 
Definitely a recommendation.

One of the best Greek places I've been to in Arizona. The food is amazing and fresh! You get plenty to fill yourself with a great price! We got two gyro plates with plenty of meat and rice, side of hummus, taziki sauce, side salad, two full size pittas, and two regular drinks for only 25 dollars. The works are friendly and very helpful. I plan on coming back frequently and recommend this place to many others.

This is by far the best place I've had Greek in the valley. The serving sizes are huge, the veggies are fresh, and the meat is tender. I order take out from here all the time and I have never had to wait for my food when I get there. There's been a couple occasions with a slightly rude person on the phone or I end up missing a salad or side item in my take out order. However, when the food is as good as it is everything else gets overlooked. I highly recommend giving this place a try but for the best experience I would dine-in.

This place has a great feel to it! You come in to order and you can see the 3 giant things of meat that they cook/cut from. 
I ordered the Gyro.. and had it for take out. The wrapped it very nicely and when I started digging in, nothing from my gryo was falling out! amazing! They have many different options and sizes for each item that you want to get. The girl who rung me up... was not so friendly at all.. so that was a MAJOR letdown for me. Customer Service is very important to me.. so definitely didn't get my tip. Sorry.. 
Other from that. The food was delicious and generous!

Since our first visit to new york my fiance and I have been obsessed with finding a decent new york street style falafel sandwich here. We have learned its all about the tahina sauce, very important. And a nice crispy on the outside ball of falafel, not the grainy or soggy stuff you tend to run into here. Well after a few complete failures, I'm looking at you pita jungle, we have found what we believe to be the closest possible substitution here at greek wraps. Their falafel is spot on, crispy out side and moist inside, and they're tahina sauce is wonderfully reminiscent of that with which we would drown our sandwiches with in new york. On the downside there is always a wait to order, despite being rushed when you are at the counter.

The best, been going like 5 years.  So fresh, call her take out.  Chicken kabob plate, hummus, great rice.  Staff always fairly friendly.  Gets quite busy.

Def one Phx best places to get Middle Eastern style
Food.
Food was so good! Fresh, and definitely a healthy alternative to other places in the area. Staff is still awesome. Absolutely somewhere I would drive out of my way to come too

Fantastic food everything we ordered was great!  It was fresh and wonderfully prepared....salads were crispy the feta cheese was perfect!   Wonderful service and customer service was top notch.    Going soon!
Very good food! The steak kabob plate is the way to go! Ate here before and love coming here again. Staff is super friendly and polite. Service is great and the price for what you pay for is good.
Awesome place, food is fantastic. You can't go wrong with any selection. Although i favor the gyros.

In the Arrowhead area, there is a mass metropolis of chain restaurants with mediocre food and average service...YAWN! 

Without having to drive very far to a {non-chain} place with good, inexpensive food, time to give GREEK WRAPS another try.

 It's located in the Old Navy shopping Center on the Southeast corner...a few doors down from Panda Express. Depending when you go, parking can be a challenge.

I haven't been in here for many, many years, because last time it was just ok... (service, food, etc)...boy, it has changed!!! It's better now!

Busy place! I think I counted 8 tables in the place and many people waiting for their take-out...or a table?

Nice, inviting decor. 

Cashier was friendly. You could see the busy cooks working efficiently and concentrating on getting the orders filled. 

The menu is easy to read without being overwhelming and has pictures of the food items. The prices are VERY reasonable & inexpensive!

The gyro pitas are $4.99 and the portions are very generous. 

Fries are $1.75, which are crunchy, steak fries in a basket...not too greasy and a nice size portion for several people to share.

Chicken kabob pita is offered in four different styles...it was $5.50 and was HUGE! The chicken itself was a tad on the salty side, but still really tasty overall.

Hummus was inexpensive with delicious flavor. It comes with 2 warm and soft pitas cut into triangles. 

They do have a kid's menu too.

Order & pay at the counter, grab a table, and wait for your number to be called. I am very happy to find a new place to eat in the area. i {heart} GREEK WRAPS!
Ground beef Greek salad is my fave.  Friendly service Great for a  quick bite or dine in.

Yes, yes, the reviews are true This place is seriously the bomb. Tried the 3 way combo plate with steak chicken and gyro and shared it with my wife. We took some home!! Great food, great staff. We will definitely be back And I have already recommended it to friends.
We bought a couple of party trays for my birthday and I have to say, it can feed a whole battalion. Not only was there a lot of food, it was also delicious, as usual. Thank you, Greek Wraps!

Hands down the best hummus and baklava in town! Their tilapia fish platter is amazing. Always very friendly service. They do get busy sometimes on the weekends, but you can call and order your food as well!

This place knocks it out of the park every time. Their chicken kabobs, fresh bread (made in house), greek salads, and gyros are all my favorite. Everything is tasty. Well deserving of 5 stars and the place is always spotless!

I was deprived of good Greek or Mediterranean food for 2 years living in the Caribbean and upon this return, this place welcomed me back with open arms and tastiness. It is better than I ever remember it being and they have expanded it some so that it is some what easier to get a table, even though it is still always crowded. Besides the space, the hardest part is deciding what to actually order because everything is excellent. My favorite is the falafel wrap (but supersize it and get the wrap, not the pita, because the bread is much better).
This restaurant is small, but serves like a beast! The prices are competitive. The dishes are abundant. The service is great. My whole family enjoyed our experience!

This place is great! I ordered the chicken shawarma greek salad and it was to die for. The only other place I've ever had such solid mediterranean flavors was in Israel. The chicken was a tad on the dry side, but the dressing and tzatziki compensated for that. Also came with a pita (always a plus). 

Overall, GREAT greek food. If you're in the mood, this place will fill your craving and then some.
One of the best gyros I've ever had. Make sure to get the 10in so that you get the fresh baked pita bread!
Affordable, very generous portions and always tastes amazing! This is my family's go to spot.
We come here all the time and LOVE IT!  It has become our "go to" Greek place.  The chicken Shawarma is especially good, but we have enjoyed everything!

Have you ever walked into a Greek restaurant that was PACKED in Arizona? Most likely not. However, when you walk into Greek Wraps and taste their food, you'll understand why they're SO busy. 

Hands down the BEST gyro pita I've ever had in Arizona. I wish it was in more locations, since Peoria is a bit far from me. If you're ever in the area and you're craving a Gyro Pita - this is a MUST STOP!! 

The only downside of this place is- it makes all other gyro pitas inferior in comparison.

Staff is friendly and the warm pitas and hummus are awesome. Unfortunately, the chicken I had was over seasoned and the beef that my friend ordered was so over seasoned that it was inedible. I may have to try again on another day.

Never disappointing. Fresh, warm, and always delicious. The food is beyond excellent and never less than that! I've been a customer for a few years and the service is always great. One of the employees named Martin, never forgets to ask how my day is going and always makes "the usual" (steak sharwarma plate) comes out never less than perfect. My go to spot, highly recommended, love this place!

Probably the best Greek food I have tried. I would have given them 5 stars but the food took a while to come out. Other than that the food was delicious and it you get a lot of food for what you paid.

This is easily one of my top favorites in the state. It never disappoints. The flaming feta hummus is absolutely delicious. As are the shwarma plates and pitas. Honestly, anything you order will be mouth watering and timely. Service is impeccable, they have  never gotten an order wrong in the years I've been coming here. You'll spend up to $12 a person, but you'll most likely leave with leftovers and definitely a happy tummy!

Hands down the best Greek food I've had in the valley. I took my sister and her husband when they came into town a year ago and it is the place they request to go every time they come to visit now. They keep trying other places only to be disappointed. 

I typically get the gyro platter which comes with a LOT of food. The side salad that is included is extremely delicious. The restaurant is small and can get busy but the staff is very friendly and helpful.
Oh man this place is AWESOME!! They're food is great, customer service is phenomenal!! And prices are amazing. Best Greek food I've had yet

Soooooo good. My favorite is the falafel plate. Beautifully crunchy on the outside, perfect inside. Rice is cooked perfectly. Portions are big, so bring a friend! 

Dining area is modest but modern, and immaculately clean. They have an extensive selection of drinks with a touch screen soda fountain, along with separate filtered water. 

Staff is friendly, cheerful, and totally on top of their game. Customers are greeted and given a warm goodby at their departure. Bus staff is lighting fast. No table is left dirty.

Take out is fast and easy. 

This is my new go to for great comfort food. 

What are you waiting for? Get down here!

Okay this place is fantastic. I was so impressed and my mouth is watering just thinking about it. I wish I lived in Arizona so I could eat this for every meal. I mean, yeah I totally would do that. 

SO I came in for lunch, it was pretty busy, but the line moved quickly. I ordered a salad, and being the indecisive person that I am, couldn't decided between the chicken and gyro meat. So I got both! And that was probably the best choice I made. 

The workers were so friendly and nice and the service was great. The food came out quick, and holy the servings were HUGE. I was so impressed! Normally places try to skimp you on the amount of protein they give you, but man they loaded it on. And it was all so delicious!! I actually liked both the chicken and gyro a ton. I also was impressed that it was a quality salad. 

Overall, I just think that the prices are reasonable, they give you a good amount of food, and they are super friendly. Delicious Mediterranean!!
This place is wonderful. Bikram Yoga Peoria recommended it and I don't ever want to eat at another Greek place. The gyro salad is my favorite, The pita bread is perfect and the staff is great.

We stopped at the Greek wraps to get gyros! They were already closed and they served us anyways! Greek Wraps were very friendly, polite and I will be a patron of this restaurant as long as I live in Arizona!
I tried the gyro. It was delicious. The food seems better than the othe Greek places I've been to.

Had a gyro sandwich with fries and it was amazing! I've never had Greek food so me and a friend decided to check what's on yelp. We saw that Greek Wraps had some good reviews. The peta bread was soft and tender, the lamb with Greek yogurt sauce was tangy and flavorful, and the lettuce and tomato added that fresh crunch! Super friendly staff and great atmosphere definitely coming back!
This is a great place!  Best gyro ever!  Super clean, fresh, delicious, a little slow but that's ok. I'll go back for sure.
This place is one of my favorites. I get the Philly Steak and it's amazing. The garlic sauce is the best. We are here at least once a month!!

I stopped in wanting a Greek chicken salad and this place did not disappoint. Some of the best grilled chicken I've eaten! Comes with pita bread and white dill sauce. I wonder if they have greek fries here?

Let me preface this review with this: I AM NOT GREEK.  However, I have tried a lot of Greek food in Phoenix, and this is by far the best cheap Greek eatery that I have experienced.  From the friendly service to the smell as you walk in, this place doesn't disappoint.

I usually do the Gyro platter, but sometimes I'll do some Falafel and the Chick Shawarma.  Everything I have tried is delicious and the service is always fast and friendly.  It can be a bit crowded in here around lunch, but that just means this place is doing something right!  If you like to avoid crowds, you can take it to-go or eat outside where there are a few tables.  There is places in the same shopping center to grab dessert or a coffee or just shop.

As far as low-priced, quick Greek food, this place is my go-to and I hope you will love it as much as I do!

Yelpers are right on again! Greek Wraps is da bomb.

Had to take my car in for service today and on the way back to pick it up the husband and I decided to try something new. As usual I sought the advice of yelp since I'm not familiar with the Peoria area.

We decided on Greek Wraps and based on past reviews I knew what I was going to have before I got there, the Steak Shawarma, he got the Gyros Plate. Both came with a Greek Salad, Hummus, Rice and a Pita. Lots of food, but we were hungry.

The salad could have had a little more flavor, but the rest of the meal was great. Now we'll have to find a reason to go back to Peoria so we can dine here again.

Greet Wraps is INCREDIBLE!! Service is excellent!!! Make sure you get there early for lunch because it gets busy and it does take a little while to get your food.  But it it SO worth the wait.  The chicken Kebob on a pita with lemon sauce is the BEST thing I've ever eaten!!

Just stopped in for lunch. It's easy to be overwhelmed by all of the dining choices near Arrowhead. The Greek Wraps is a no-brainer.

Clean and upscale convenient dining, very pleasant and accommodating staff, and the best Gyro on the West-Side...

You will not be disappointed.

Totally underestimated food- everything I've tried has been great. You cannot beat the value. If you went across the street to Pita Jungle to have a very similar meal, you'd pay about 20% more per order.

There's an open kitchen and everything is made fresh right in plain sight. Their food is always well seasoned and it's pretty healthy for a fast-casual place. Order yourself some Falafel while you await your salad or entree and ask for extra dipping sauce for it.

They do close at 8, the CFL lighting is not at all cozy and it gets really busy for dinner, however the food and service are so good that I don't mind. Greek Wraps feels like a family business and they really seem to care that you're having a good meal and that you'll come back for more.

Who doesn't love a good Mediterranean spot? This was one of my favorite go to spots for a chicken kabob plate or simply just a gyro!! It's a nice little spot, parking can be a little tight around here & the wait can tend to be a little while depending on what you order. But the food is worth it.

They put just the right amount to tzatziki sauce on their gyros. & the gyros are also so packed with meat!  Its so packed with meat that I usually have to pick some of it off before I can take an actual bite haha. Not too salty or oily like other places are either. Their fried are thick cut, fried to the perfect crisp. I LOVE their chicken kabob plate though. Their chicken is so flavorful. I usually sub the rice for fries. & their hummus is good as well. 

I recommend that if your are simply placing an order to go for one of the kabob plates, call and order ahead of time because the wait is usually about 15-20 mins long.

It is very very hard to screw up Greek food. True, some is better than others but a lot of it follows (or should follow) recipes that have been around since Aristotle.

Up until I actual started eating my food I was a fan. I liked the vibe, I liked the menu choices, I liked the positive reviews that brought me in and I liked that they were packed at almost 7 PM on a sweltering August evening when that part of town is pretty much shut down already.

I ordered the Steak Shawarma 10" wrap at $8.99.  By the way their online menu shows it at $7.99. As much effort as they put into social media I don't believe they "forgot" to update the price by a buck at their website. Tacky.

Take a look at the photo of MY sandwich compared to their highly retouched professionally photographed version of the same sandwich. They are not even on the same planet as far as what the sandwich looks like.

The kiss of death however was that the pita bread it was served in was uncooked inside, that's right it was actually raw dough that looked and felt like those Pillsbury dinner rolls in the refrigerated tube you get at the grocery store ... before you cook them. It was 100% uneatable.  I imagine their reason is that the place was swamped 15 minutes before closing on a Sunday night and they didn't have time to fully cook the pitas before serving them.  But in business a reason shouldn't be an excuse; they should have been professional and grown-up enough to come over and tell me that they were closing and all wanted to go home and didn't have time to fully cook the bread and suggest I order something else. Because they didn't they dropped their rating down from 4 or 5 stars to 1 star.  That's a sad way to lose business.

Other than that the place looked reasonably clean.  The service was what you might expect from a bunch of young guys who are 15 minutes from getting off work on a weekend and have a lot more on their minds than having to deal with last-minute customers. In other words the service wasn't very good.  While my order was being prepared I watched the guys in the kitchen. It was sort of like watching food being prepped at a McDonalds if you know what I mean.

This place has huge potential and with a good manager could be a very good place to find Greek food. But my first impression is that they just don't care.

[EDIT] It's now a month later. My final comment on this place is I believe they just don't care. Any reputable business that served raw food to a customer would be all over themselves apologizing. These people didn't even bother to post a comment saying "sorry". Since then I found another place "Gyro Point" on Peoria Ave that is night & day better than this place. I suggest you try them.

Greek Wraps; You never cease to amaze me. 

I practically lived at this place when i lived closer. But every excuse i can get I travel from Scottsdale to get this amazing food!! Every meat they have is moist and cooked to perfection while BOOMING with flavor. The portions are big but satisfies your every craving. Make sure to order a "fresh bread" on the side for a dollar extra. You wont be disappointed.

:)

Best greek place I've been too in the North Valley. They make all of their breads fresh. The chicken and steak is well marinated. Sometimes the Chicken can be a little dry. Overall, it's a great lunch spot.

We've been to this place 5-6 times and have NEVER been disappointed. The food is very fresh and seems to be of excellent quality. The staff has always been attentive, pleasant and helpful. It's clean and the employees are diligent about clearing tables as they become available.   The food takes a bit to come out BUT I am TOTALLY ok with that because I'd rather wait for great food than have "ok" food faster.  
The only reason I didn't give it five stars..... 
It gets warm in there during the warmer months. Perhaps it's an attempt to reduce costs. The only suggestion I'd make is to recognize our hot months and keep the dining room more comfortable.  They are so accommodating and approachable but sometimes the dining room makes us wish we ordered it "to go". 
Still LOVE IT and will keep going back!

There is a reason this place is rated the way it is. Quite frankly, its elite. Ive been eating here for a long time... Its one of the best places in town. Usually about 15-20 minutes to order and can be tough to find a place to sit, so recommend taking it to go. You can sub out rice for fries if you want, their fries are awesome. Make sure to ask for the house hot sauce. Its amazing!

I ordered a gyro plate (gyro meat, rice, pots bread, hummus and a side salad) to go. 

Delicious is about right. Good is an understatement. If you like Mediterranean style food then this is the place to go. Enough said.
It's a good thing that this place is not closer to where I live or I would weigh 400 pounds.
I love this place! Their salads are huge, bursting with flavor and the employees are always nice. Best place on the West side for Greek.

I have been here 3 times with 3 different groups of people over the past month or so and each time has been a pleasure for everyone. I am vegetarian, my daughter vegan and everyone else I have been here with eats whatever and this place has met all of our dietary needs perfectly... and with a smile to boot! 

I enjoy the vegetarian appetizer platter as a meal, which comes with the best falafel I have had in any restaurant. My daughter orders the falafel salad and my husband enjoys the falafel wrap. We know our falafel! They also have excellent dolmas, tabouli, hummus & baba ganoush, 

Nice little place with both indoor and outdoor seating. After your order they bring your food to you, whether your inside or out. It's clean and service is fast and friendly.
Tried so many Greek/middle eastern food in Phoenix, nothing tops this place. Food is delicious and full of flavor. The employees are all so friendly we love coming back
The steaks kabobs are the best i have ever had. Place is clean with great service. This place does get busy so its best to call the order in.

Pretty good stuff! We got two plates - a chicken shawarma and a gyros plate. Next time, I would probably just get the gyro sandwich.  The chicken shawarma had a great flavor and the hummus was excellent. I didn't really care for the rice and thought it was a bit dry. The customer service was great!

Greek Wraps makes me happy because it's delish gyro only minutes from home. Their gyro pita is very filling. Lots of well seasoned meat. Not dry. Pita is fluffy. Everything comes out hot. It's a small establishment and the service can be slow when it's busy, but the food makes up for it. I once got the falafel and hummus plate. I've been wanting to order it again, but I'm usually craving meat when I go. Hummus serving was huge. It lasted me 3 meals. I never had falafel before so I'm not expert but it tasted good to me. Ate everything within two days. I'll be going back to GW for more Greek food cravings.

I should have written this review years ago!! This was my go to when I lived in Glendale. Now I live in Cali and not a day goes by that I don't think about Greek Wraps and it's amazing garlic sauce *cries*. I compare ever greek restaurant I eat at to Greek Wraps and NOTHING compares. One day I will be reunited with it and it will be magical!
I am a fan of their pita.  It was so fresh and warm.  Excellent!  I prefer the hummus at Pita Jungle though.

I definitely recommend the gyros plate. Comes with a small greek salad that always tastes freshly made. For $10, you get one pita, a scoop of hummus, yellow rice, and of course a good amount of gyros with tzatziki sauce. It's quite a lot of food and could probably feed two people/split into two meals. The rice is delicious and the gyros are nicely seasoned. The employees are also really nice. The restaurant itself is medium sized, though it's usually pretty packed whenever I've gone, especially at dinner and even near closing time.

Took off a star because once I ordered the chicken shawarma plate and unfortunately the chicken was pretty dry.
Not Great. Rice undercooked. Steak Bland. Gyro overly salty (consistently) - which is something because I like salt.
I've been to this place many times.  I go out of my way to eat there.  Staff is wonderful.  Food is consistently wonderful.  Great food.  Great service.  Reasonable price.  What more can you ask for.

#1 - MUST have their garlic dipping sauce...so good!

I like that they have really cheap appetizers...I ordered all the $1.00 ones. I figured I might as well try them since they're cheap and see if I like them. I liked the Falafel, Spanakopita, and their bread (so good). 

The food is pretty good and the portion is perfect (okay, maybe it's just a tad bit more than enough). 

The workers are super friendly!
Always fresh and delicious.  I mostly stick with the humus and grilled tilapia. They are both outstanding.  What more can I say? Greek Wraps is my favorite joint in town.

I'm a big fan of Greek food so this place was pretty much an Oasis for my family and me. We've been going to this place for about three to four years now and the quality of food has stayed consistent along with the amazing customer service. The place is small and gets very busy especially during lunch and dinner so finding a seat can be difficult. There is seating outside which is better for the cooler months in Arizona or summer nights once the sun has went down. 

I've ordered a variety off the menu but my favorite would have to be the Gyro Wrap. The pita bread is good, but the wrap is made with the house bread which is baked fresh every day. The gyro meat can be seen being sliced in the kitchen which I think is cool. The tzatziki sauce is awesome and I would definitely recommend order an extra side of sauce for your meal. It costs $0.50 but totally worth it in my opinion. The Chicken Wrap is just as good in my opinion. The meat is always well seasoned and juicy. This is a good option for someone who is new to Greek food and may not be a fan of very strong flavors like the typical gyro meat contains. 

Recently I tried the Ground Beef Kabob Plate which comes with hummus and three pieces of beef kabob on a bed of rice. The hummus is great, and I'm actually not a big fan of hummus in general. The rice is okay. There isn't too much flavor to it, but it's definitely not bad. The first time I tried this plate I must have had a fluke because the kabob was unfortunately tried out, but I could tell there was flavor. I gave the beef kabob another chance but this time in a Ground Beef Wrap and it was to die for. Might be my new favorite thing! The meat was more flavorful than I remember and super juicy. 

I've only tried their baklava once but it was delicious and cheap. I could have had five of those things. 

All in all, I love this place. I miss it whenever I go away for college and demand at least one meal there when I visit the family. The customer service is consistently phenomenal and have yet had a bad experience with the employees.
great food, good service and prices are reasonable. they have a good variety menu would certainly eat there again.

Baba Ganoush and Dolmas are yummy. 

GET THE GROUND BEEF KABOB SANDWICH. Its not on the menu but you can request it. It's delicious and so filling, I prefer the pita over the wrap for choice of bread but its whatever you like.

This place has good food but the menu yes it has pictures and stuff but the name of the food is written on the board so small I can't even read it and  I have good eyes! Besides that, everything is fresh and delicious.

This used to be one of my favorite quick lunch spots in the northwest valley.  The portions are huge, the prices are totally affordable, the staff is always friendly, and if you order one of the wraps, they fire/cook the bread right there in front of your eyes!  And it's delicious by the way!  Definitely try one of the wraps if you stop in but beware...you might need a wheelbarrow to cart yourself out!
Great food and service. Must try the steak kabob plate and if u like chicken as well. Get the combo plate! Very filling so no need to order any extra.

I was looking for a place that I didn't have to spend a lot to get good food. This place fulfilled that need. Although it is the first time I did have Greek food I can say that it was really good food. Just a standard place that serves good food.
Decent gyros but I felt like it took too long to get one during lunch. I'll be back during dinner and try that next time. Place is tiny so don't expect to find a table at lunch. It's packed in there.

I made a tough decision today. It was either get Juju Berry fro-yo, or buy a gyro from this fine establishment. Obviously, my choice was the gyro, I'll save fro-yo for when I'm only partially hungry. Otherwise, if I do choose fro-yo when I'm starving, its like a 12 buck fro-yo...just not a good look. But I digress.

Of the many times I have visited, I've only ordered the gyro from here. But every time I do, I make a sloppy but delicious mess of that gyro and myself. I like it here, have yet to dine in, its clean but there isn't really much to look at or any form of an entertainment factor here. Some places just have character, and I tend to not take out from them. So yes, minus the star on the rating for capturing my dinning and entertainment combo requirement. But its still a really good and affordable gyro!

Hands down the best mediterranean food I've had in Phoenix.  In a strip mall off 73rd Ave. Expect it to be busy and for your food to take about 10 minutes to arrive.  Portions are huge...the meat is flame grilled and juicy, pita's are are fresh, salads are wonderful.  Love this little place.

This is one of my two top dining destinations in the Arrowhead area.  My husband and I make a trip across town at least once a week to indulge in the fresh, healthy menu options.  I have tried several menu items but always lean toward the Lemon Chicken Pita meal-with tender white meat chicken grilled to perfection-juicy and an ample portion.  The servers anticipate our order-which is a nice welcome-in the often impersonal restaurant world.  The food is cooked to order-so sit tight-but it is well worth the wait.  It is a family run business-and all of the employees are personable-and have been there as long as we have been patrons-which speaks to a well run business.  It is always clean and well organized-even when it is busy with customers.

One of my favorite Mediterranean Greek places when I am in the Arrowhead Peoria area I love the fresh bread I love the chicken kebab salads I love the steak kebab salads and I love the homemade green hot sauce. I wish their garlic sauce was a little bit more garlic  flavor and less mint flavor. And I love the staff very nice and friendly people.

This place and king gyros are my two go to. I switch off when I'm burnt out of the other lol. All their food is amazing, and Josh has some untouchable customer service skills and is very personable. Go there when you need the greek good fix

The best, I repeat, THE BEST Greek Chicken Caesar Salad on the planet, bar none. I've eaten at this establishment dozens of time over the last decade and it never ceases to amaze me how good the food is here. Best part of it all is that the service staff just as good. Wait time for the food runs a bit long but it's worth every second of the wait.
Amazing experience! Very authentic food with delicious sauce. Welcomed when I walked by a very professional staff the explained the menu to me in detail. Definitely coming back!
Unbelievably great restaurant!  I'm from Chicago & this is the best  Greek restaurant I've been to in Phoenix.
Best Greek food in Phoenix!! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu! The whole staff is friendly and the interior is always clean.

This is our go-to Greek place. The food is always fresh, delicious and made to order. I have tried chicken shawarma other places and no one compares to Greek Wraps, they are the best. They have a real good variety, from pitas to salads to meals... They do get pretty busy so bring your patience during the lunch rush. They do have a few outside tables also for when the weather is nice.

I accidentally went here instead of Greek Raps, which was the place I initially had in mind. So instead of listening to Aristotle drop lines to a sick beat, I was treated to a pleasantly tasteful and authentic meal that Caesar himself would have been proud of. I will soon return to this establishment for another helping of chicken schwarma, the taste of which would have enlightened the minds of even Socrates and Plato.
I love this place for lunch and takeout for dinner. They always have very fresh food and great prices too. They work hard to fill your order promptly.

I'm always a fan of local, hole in the wall restaurants that reflect the community while offering tasty high value food. Greek Wraps wins on all counts. I'm particularly partial to their plates full of lots of yummy items--this restaurant is vegetarian friendly. I loved my gyro this evening---which at $7 and change including fries and a soda is a good value.

My fav! Everything I have tried has rocked! Very crowded the past few times I have gone and they chug extra for everything even simple things like a little extra taziki sauce. Very good though and worth the crowd

Can't get any better than this. We are moving to the other side of Phoenix and we will so miss this place. You can't go wrong with anything you order. My mouth waters just thinking about it. And if you leave out the feta its Whole30 compliant!!!

I grew up eating here, my dad introduced it to us as kids and we all fell in love with it! To this day my husband & I still come here, I've never had a bad meal or experience. The staff is always SO friendly and helpful. The food is always fresh and delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!

this has been one the places i crave for in the two years that i have spent in Glendale...
I love the chicken schwarma.... although i agree with Nadia on the fact that it does get a little drippy over the end. 
but overall really good food, quick service, and not expensive... 
for that cost, its healthy food that fills you up...
Go for Greek Wraps, and trust me you wont regret it....

Delicious, quick meal with generous portions! I tried the chicken kabob plate which came with chicken kabob (shocking, I know), rice, hummus, salad, tzatziki sauce, and bread. I enjoyed all of it and was able to bring some home to enjoy later. I did feel that the rice was a little dry so I ate it with the hummus to moisten it up at bit. Besides that, everything was tasty. I also admired the great service.

The place is small and busy beyond belief at 1:30pm, which was a good sign! The staff is exceptionally friendly; Came in with my daughter who is in a wheelchair and they helped me find a seat, which never happens unfortunately. 

The sandwiches are nice sized and very tasty. This was the best tasting gyros I've had since leaving Chicago. And the staff was amazing. We'll be back!

I tried this place this weekend at the suggestion of friends who live nearby. The place is very clean and had an open kitchen, which is always a plus in my book.  The service was very good and we got our food quickly.

They are grilling some great looking beef and chicken here, yet sadly I didn't see any lamb on the menu.  I had the tri-tip kebab sandwich and my wife had the gyro.  Both were very tasty but what really made the meal was the 10'' pitas they are making from scratch.  They have a 6" pita that appears to be sourced from Kronos (the large Greek food supply company, not the young Titan and son of Ouranos and Gaea) but the 10" pita is homemade and ridiculously good. It has more in common with a buttery roti than a pita. Big-ups to my friend Emir for cluing me in on them.  We also had the Flaming Feta, it was fantastic, we'll definitely be getting it again.  If you like heat, be sure to ask them for their Greek hot sauce, it was a very spicy green sauce that had a unique flavor that I really enjoyed.  The only downside to the meal was the quality of the veggies in the sandwiches.  The tomatoes were pale and mealy and the lettuce was a little wilted.

I'll be returning to Greek Wraps, the 10" pita is something I'll be craving until I have another crack at it.  There were also several other dishes on the menu that looked to have a lot of potential.  If you're in the area stop in and get some very good Greek grub.

Seinfeld fans may remember the "soup Nazi", and this restaurant sometimes reminds me of that episode.  You have to endure a business location that is far, far too small for the amount of traffic that goes through there, the food can take a long time, and it is often inconsistent but sometimes amazingly good.

Their "wraps" are really just handmade pita that is more like Indian Naan bread used as pita, and it is quite good, especially with falafel.

me and my wife been looking for a top quality mediterranean food place and finally found it!
chicken is so soft and juicy grilled to perfection hummus and salad is amazing and price is perfect cant complain one bit.

After moving to Glendale for medical school last year, Greek Wraps has been one of the few restaurants I visit on an almost weekly basis. The gyros here are the best in town, and it's all HALAL which is an amazing plus for any fellow Muslim brothers or sisters. I went there today and ordered a steak kabob sandwich, venturing outside my usual 10 inch gyro wrap. I didn't realize the steak kabob had hummus on it and started having a slight allergic reaction (allergic to sesame, from what I tasted though and for what it's worth, it was a great sandwich with good cuts of steak). I told one of the servers and they immediately swapped out my sandwich with something else without hummus; they were apologetic and did it ASAP with no questions asked. 

Great service, great food. I strongly suggest everyone checks this place out!

I love this place, the food is absolutely delicious, healthy and fresh. Prices are reasonable and they give you a lot of food for the price you pay. The staff are very nice and pleasant. If they mess up your order, they will own up to it and make it right. I eat here about 3-4 times a week. My fav dishes are the ground beef plate, Greek salad and falafel. They use fresh feta cheese and make their own hummus. They are very busy because they're so so good so I'd recommend calling in your order so you can just come pick up and leave.
First time here. I had a gyro wrap and fries.  The food was great and the service was even better. This place is definitely on the shortlist for me.
The food is amazing. The customers are rude... Super super rude. Take out dont dine in its always busy... Online menu thegreekwraps.com

Many years ago I was introduced to Mediterranean food by a coworker and have been craving chicken schwarma ever since. Unfortunately the place I used to go to went out of business and I started looking for another place that offered it. I found The Greek Wraps years ago and tried their schwarma wrap sandwich. I was not impressed. Perhaps there's a difference between a Greek and Lebanese recipe it I didn't care for it and I didn't go back.

A couple of years ago my wife and I went to a Lebanese restaurant in Arlington, VA and they had amazing chicken schwarma. This made us want to find a restaurant near home that offers this dish.

The Greek Wraps is in a strip mall next to a Panda Express and a Jamba Juice and my wife asked if I knew anything about this place and I told her I had been there a long time ago and didn't like it. But she wanted to try it so we went and gave it a shot. Knowing the schwarma wasn't all that good I tried the chicken kabob plate. Wow! This dish is amazing, so full of flavor and it made up for the bad experience I had years ago.

When I find a dish at a restaurant I love, I don't usually try anything else. I did try the chicken kabob as a sandwich and while the flavor was the same, it was really messy, which was also the problem when I first ate here. Stick with the plate...if you think a sandwich will be easier to eat, you will be mistaken.

This is one dish I feel like I could eat unlimited quantities of. However, one entree is actually enough to feed both myself and my wife. The chicken kabob comes with yellow rice, hummus and pita bread, salad and a garlic sauce. It is a very satisfying meal and considering the amount of food you get it's a bargain. I have no desire to try anything else here because this is one of my favorite meals.

I do need to add that my wife hasn't been particularly happy with the quality of the chicken the last few times we've had this so am giving 4 stars instead of 5. I have no complaints however.

I would give them more than 5 stars if it was an option. Great, fast service in a clean restaurant serving delicious food. They give a student discount with ID (not much but every bit helps). Steak shwarma wrap is my personal fav.

My taste buds thank you !!!  So happy to have found a place that compares to the gyros from our "dirt mall" swap mart back in Ohio.  The 7" gyro is packed with meat, fries are always fresh (enough for 2 people). They are very busy at lunch time, but worth the wait. Sooooo good!!!!

We go here often but not as often as we used to. Just need to mix it up a bit. 
We have always got exceptionally good food and service. 
For Greek food, wraps, plates this is the place we aways go. 
If you go during the lunch hour be prepared to wait on a table. There is outside seating but when the weather is cool, but some people do sit out side in the cool weather and hot weather. I like to get a table inside. The trick is to get there just before the lunch rush or just after the rush. 
We usually get a meal with a large wrap and fries. We have them cut the wrap in half. This is plenty for two people.
If you are in the area go see them. We have always been happy we stoppen in.

Everything I have had at Greek Wraps is good. My personal favorite is the chicken shwarma with rice. The restaurant itself is clean and well lit and the staff are friendly. We do eat here but prefer to take food home because it can be somewhat packed in here.

We love this place so much we go once a week and had them cater our wedding reception/party!!

Everyone knows it's good, so it's usually pretty busy, but they work fast and it's worth the wait. I've had most everything on the menu and I can't say enough good stuff about it. They do something different to the gyro meat that makes it so much better. The pita bread is fresh and awesome and the hummus is just as good. 

The portions are large as well, my wife and I can split the supreme kabob plate and be plenty full when we leave. My 4 year old daughter even loves this place, and she doesn't eat from the kids menu.

A solid Greek restaurant on the west side. Expect a line during lunch hours and don't be surprised if the seating area is full, but don't worry the wait is never that long. The staff is very friendly and helpful if you have any questions about the menu. A variety of menu options and it's all good, don't forget the baklava.
